Santo Domingo has a warm tropical cliimate suitable for agriculture, cattle ranching and poultry raising.

Carmen is asking for a loan for the first time. She needs it to buy more chickens and to fix the barn where she keeps them. She works an average of 10 hours a day and receives help from her husband and children when they have some free time. For Carmen it has been very difficult to start up her own business. She only has a primary school education and that is why many opportunities have been closed to her. If Carmen receives this loan, it will help her to make more income and bring her closer to her dream of having her own poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Jyambere/makoro Group

texts.fr:
Jean Baptiste fait partie du groupe Jyambere /Makoro. Le nom du groupe signifie «Le groupe de progrès». Il a 30 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 4 à 7 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Baptiste est cultivateur de pomme de terre. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences des pommes de terre, des engrais chimiques et payement main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des pommes de terre, il planifie d’utiliser  des semences  sélectionné des qualités et acheter d’autres champs pour agrandir le terrain. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Baptiste voudrait  devenir un grand distributeur de pommes de produits agricole surtout  pommes de terre. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants, construire une belle maison et améliore le niveau de mange dans sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is part of the group  Jyambere /Makoro. The group's name means "The Group of Progress". He is 30 years old and married, and he has two children, 4 and 7 years old, of whom one is in school. He has a 6th grade education.

Jean Baptiste is a potato farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizers and to pay workers. 

To expand his potato farming, he plans to use quality select seeds and to buy more fields for extending his terrain. In the next few years, he would like to become a major distributor of farm products, especially potatoes. With the profits, he plans to send his children to school and build a nice house.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizers and to pay workers

loans.name: Mariama Djiba

texts.fr: Madame  MARIAMA  est une femme mariée qui réside au SENEGAL. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis 2005 et exerce la vente d’huile de palme et de bouillie de mil. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC. Elle sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 200000FCFA. Le financement  lui permettra de s’approvisionner  en grande quantité en produits  en vue de répondre à la demande croissante de sa clientèle durant  le mois de ramadan. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux développer son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Ms. MARIAMA is a married woman who resides in Senegal. She has been active in commerce since 2005 and sells palm oil and millet porridge. She is a member of one of the U-IMCEC branch offices. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 200,000 francs CFA. The financing will enable her to stock up on a large quantity of products with the aim of responding to the growing demands of her customers during the month of Ramadan. Her goal is to increase her profits to develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and some millet for business purposes

loans.name: Alberto Aparicio

texts.en:
Alberto is an artisan who crafts ceramic figurines and candleholders with traditional Andean themes. He would like to invest in raw materials so as to have plenty of stock ready when the high sales season arrives.

Alberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I am inspired by the customs and beliefs of Andean villages. I've been a ceramist since I was a child, as my parents taught me the craft. Later, I tried to develop my own pieces with a personal style. My main purpose is giving life to my creations, and I've achieved this through the expressions of their faces, aiming to reflect daily attitudes, Peruvian country scenes, even protests - and I'm satisfied and content. My wife works with me. Most of our pieces are hand-molded, as only the weight of the hand can give the right shape. We use clay and simple tools; pigments are carefully blended together. I hope that my art will be valued for its cultural background." 

"I'd like to send you many blessings and my prayer that God keep you safe, always. My family and I need this credit to purchase materials and increase our stock of ceramic designs. In this way, we want to make our workshop grow and be able to provide a better future for our children. Many, many thanks for supporting Peruvian artisans like us."

Use the link below to view Alberto's ceramic folk art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=1747

loans.use: to invest in raw materials so as to have plenty of stock ready when the high sales season arrives

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria uses jeweler's techniques learned from her husband to create dazzling pre-Hispanic replica masks and vessels in bronze and copper. She would like to purchase raw materials such as copper and bronze for her work.

Ana Maria has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is her story:

"For 24 years I have dedicated myself to metalwork in the city where I married. My husband is an able jeweler, from whom I learned the art of working with silver and plaques. Today we have a small family workshop in which my children are also involved, and we work together with dedication, constantly developing new products. In my work I seek to recover the folklore and joy of the Andean people."

"I am so grateful to be able to offer my designs to so many families around the world, giving them a bit of the art and culture of my beautiful country. Thank you for your assistance with this microcredit loan."

Use the link below to view Ana Maria's copper and bronze Andean replicas on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2843

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as copper and bronze for her work

loans.name: Newen Pu Domo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama  “Newen pu Domo” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de leña, almacén, venta de ropa, repostería, florería, venta de joyas, repuestos de vehículo, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Yasna, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada, ocupando el tercer el lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un poleron de color rosado, su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio con maquinas de juego de azar y paquetería, desde hace 7 años. Comenta que trabaja junto con su madre, ya que ella tiene una florería en el mismo negocio de Yasna, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en supermercados y distribuidoras, y otras veces compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de invierno para mujer para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Yasna es seguir creciendo y poder abastecer su negocio con otras provisiones para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Yasna vive junto a su esposo y 2 hijas de 11 y 3 años de edad. Sus sueño a nivel personal es terminar sus estudios universitarios, y a nivel laboral seguir generando ganancias ya que tiene la necesidad de contar con más recursos en el hogar, porque los hijos van creciendo y al mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de darles un buen pasar y una buena educación.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que es muy unido. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called  “Newen pu Domo”. It is made up of 18 entrepeneurs who work in different areas. Among them are selling firewood, selling clothes, a small store, selling clothes, pastry making, selling flowers, selling jewelry, selling car parts, and service, among others. All of them belong to the city of Temuco.

Yasna, the president of the communal bank group. In the photo, she is seated thrd from the right. She is wearing a oink t-shirt and her hair is light brown and loose. 
.
She has worked selling gambling games and packaging for 7 years. She says that she works with her mother, since she has a flower shop in the same place where Yasna has her business. She works Monday to Sunday and her hours are according to her availability. 

The merchandise she needs she buys from supermarkets and distributors. Other times she buys it from the city of Santiago at a low cost, so it is financially convenient.  With the loan, she will buy women's winter clothing to stock her business. 

One of Yasna's goals is to keep growing and be able to stock her business with other provisions to generate more income as well as have a better quality of life. Yasna lives with her husband and 2 daughters, aged 11 and 3. Her dream on a personal level is to finish college. On a professional level, it is to keep generating income. since she needs to have more resources for her home and a good education. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by the Fondo Esperanza, since it allowed her to invest in her business. In regards to the communal bank she belongs to, she remarks that it is very close. The trainings have also served her to learn new sales and accounting strategies.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago ( the capital of Chile). Surrounding it is a series of lake beaches (Pucón, Villarrica) and very beautiful flora and fauna in the nearby nature parks. It is worth noting that in this region lives 50% of the Mapuches, an existing indigenous people of our country.

loans.use: to buy women's winter clothes to stock her business.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is applying for her second loan from KADET Ltd after repaying the previous loan successfully. Violet will use this loan to buy sacks of dry maize, beans and wheat for sale. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her grandchildren. Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for storing her cereals and to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize, beans and wheat

loans.name: Msisiri Group

texts.en:
Helena, who is in her early 20s, is single. She has had a grocery store for two years now.  She works from 2:00 pm to midnight daily, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Helena's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, She wants to use it to buying items missing from the grocery store. Her dream is to one day be able to open another grocery in a different area.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "Msisiri," which has 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy missing items for her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Mohamed from Kulanda town in the southern district of Bo. He is divorced with a two-year-old child. He has four relatives who are living with him. He began his electronics business to generate income to support his young child and his relative.

At his shop, Mohamed sells generators, musical sets, DVDs, radios, and televisions. He has been running this business for 10 years. He works at the business every day, 7 days per week. The business is his only source of income. He says that the main challenge to his business is low purchasing power during the rainy season.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy more generators, musical sets, DVDs, radios, and televisions. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living.  In the future, he plans to open a supermarket. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more generators, musical sets, DVDs, radios, and televisions.

loans.name: Amistad 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of this group called Amistad (Friendship) 4. Ana is a single mother of three children. Her business consists of making hair products like shampoo, conditioner and anti-frizz serum as well as disinfectant for floors and home surfaces. 

Ana purchases chemicals from local distributors to make her products and packs them for distribution. Her finished products are sold in small grocery stores and in her own home. In addition, Ana is a dressmaker, sewing clothes and decorative pieces like curtains, bathroom sets and bedspreads. With this loan, Ana will buy chemical products (sodium chloride, boric acid, menthol, methyl salicylate, glycerin, fruit fragrance, cetyl alcohol, etc.) for hair and household products.

Ana’s most important challenge is to see her children become professionals. God has given her the strength to work hard as a single mother, to provide for her family and to send her children to study. She enjoys sewing and making products. She has received 16 loans with Esperanza and with her first loan, she bought a sewing machine and started making student uniforms. 

Ana's dream is to have a big factory to produce her chemical-based products and to sell them in other cities and in big department stores. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy chemical products (sodium chloride, boric acid, menthol, methyl salicylate)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns bookshop, a business which she has been operating for three years. Besides this business, Ruth earns some income from the rental houses she owns. She learnt about Milango through a friend and her aim is accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is a seasonal market.

Ruth is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase books, pencils, pens, manila paper, rubbers and rulers. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard her family. Her plan for the future is to open three more bookshops.

loans.use: To purchase books, pencils, pens, manila paper, rubbers and rulers.

loans.name: Chimanga

texts.en:
Chimanga lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a coffee cafe, a business that he has been operating for eleven months. He started the business through his personal savings.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, high fuel and transport costs and taxes.

Chimanga is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase food stock, e.g., tea leaves, flour, etc. to use in the cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children. His future plan is to have a big restaurant other than a coffee cafe.

loans.use: To purchase food stock, e.g. tea leaves, flour, etc. to use in the cafe.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 33ans, Madame Ama est mariée à un employé dans une société de la place. Ils n’ont pas d’enfants en charge. Elle est couturière et en même temps fait la vente de pagnes  et des produits de mercerie dans une boutique et au marché. En cette période de vacances, il y a des variétés de motifs (pagnes) qui sortent et elle manque de fonds pour s’approvisionner en marchandises c’est pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner des jolis pagnes et des articles de mercerie. Elle veut agrandir son stock de marchandises et vendre des pagnes de bonne qualité.
texts.en:
A young woman, 33 years old, Ms. Ama is married to an employee of a local company. They have no children to support. She is a seamstress and, at the same time, she sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and sewing supplies in a shop and at the market. 

During this vacation period, there are varieties of designs ('pagnes') that come out, and she lacks the funds for stocking up on this merchandise. This is why she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES, so as to supply herself with pretty 'pagne' cloth and sewing supplies. She wants to expand her stock of merchandise and sell good quality 'pagnes'.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth and some sewing supplies

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He has two children, none of whom attends school. He is a fishmonger, a business that he has been operating for ten years.

He learnt about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the fluctuating market due to seasonal market and perishability of his products.

Gilbert is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy fishing nets and freezers. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to cater for the needs of the family. His plan for the future is to expand to a wholesale fish mongering business.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and freezers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 52-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four children, three of whom who are still attending school. He owns a small lot where he offers different types of automotive spare parts. He has worked in this occupation since 1990. Regardless of his older age, Ali works very hard to support his family and satisfy their needs. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electric generator for his business. This purchase will smooth his work operations and allow him to perform his job properly, especially because he uses multiple electric devices while accomplishing his work tasks. This is his first Kiva loan, and he hopes to be able to achieve remarkable growth in a short period. In the future, he plans to expand his business operations into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase an electric generator for his business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 37-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and four children, all of whom are attending school. Since 1998, he has owned a poultry shop where he sells delicious fresh chicken and sandwiches. His business is the main source of income for the family. Over the years, Hussein has been able to expand his business and hire a full-time employee. 

Hussein is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his shop’s decor, purchase an electric generator for his business, and build a tent next to his shop in order to welcome customers properly and allow them to enjoy eating his tasty food comfortably. He is very optimistic and confident that the loan will allow him to gain more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop, purchase a generator, and build a tent next to his shop

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 57-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1996. He transports customers to their destinations, wherever they may be. 

Ahmad is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform necessary maintenance on his car, including the inside and the outside. He took advantage of a previous Kiva loan, and he was very satisfied with the results, especially because the loan amount was sufficient to fulfill his business needs. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new car and hire a part-time employee in order to increase his profits and expand his business.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his car

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a boutique, a business that he has been operating for seventeen years. He started the business through his personal savings.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, high fuel and transport costs.

David is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy a plot of land and build a house. His future plan is to expand and have a shop where he will be selling wholesale.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Changamwe area of Coast province. He is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a food cafe and he is a water vender, a business he has been operating for seventeen years now. Apart from that, he has an income from rental houses and farming.

Paul learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges he is facing are competition, shortage of water and lack of reservoirs, an issue he believes can be sorted once he acquires the water tanks.

Paul is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy water tanks. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his living standard. His future plan is to open more food cafes and bigger ones.

loans.use: To buy water tanks.

loans.name: Theophilous

texts.en:
Theophilous lives in the Changamwe area of Coast province. He has one child. He owns a transport business; a three-wheeler vehicle which is preferred in the interior of major towns within the coastal area. The business has been operating for two years now.

He learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges he is facing are high fuel and transport costs.

Theophilous is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to repair the three-wheeler vehicle. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his living standard. His future plans are to expand and employ people to work for him.

loans.use: To repair his three-wheeler vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts for the motorbike and service his motorbike.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a beautiful single lady who has been running a shop for the last four years. She sells in her neighborhood and to the general public. She also operates a tailoring business, as her brother assists her in running the shop. She has requested a loan so as to increase her inventory in her shop. The loan will enable her to purchase barrels of flour, cooking oil, sodas, etc. This will allow her to continue to serve her ever growing clientele. She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale in the future.

Loice lives in the district of Kinango, in the western region of the city of Mombasa, Kenya. She trained in business courses and she is happy that she is applying them in the practical world. She is grateful to Kiva and Yehu for the opportunity given.

loans.use: to purchase barrels of flour, cooking oil, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Mutuku

texts.en:
Mutuku is 62 years old. He is married to Jane and together they have five adult children. He has been in the poultry business for four years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

The loan will be used to buy poultry feeds and some chicks for rearing. The anticipated profits will be used to pay college fees for his children. This is his second loan with KADET LTD, and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. His hope and dream is to become a wholesale distributor of chicken products.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and more chicks.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Ali from Kandeh town in the southern district of Bo, Sierra Leone. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 14 and 22. His children are currently attending school. In 1998, Ali established his used clothing business. He began his business so that he could develop himself and his family. He works 11 hours a day, 7 days per week.  He says that his main challenge is insufficient capital to invest in his business.

Ali requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, Ali plans to import used clothes from overseas. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 26 years old; she is a widow and she has a child. She started this beauty salon  in 2010 with a working capital of $1,000. She lives in a house made of bricks with zinc for a roof. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy needed items for her beauty salon. She is earning a good income from her activities. She has a dream to open a big beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy needed items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Bibosi Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento BIBOSI Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Dora tiene 26 años, tiene dos hijo de la edades de 1 y 9  años. La Sra. Dora se dedica a la  actividad de venta de ropa, ella tiene su puesto de venta en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Dora va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada de invierno  como chompas y chamarras  y así de esta manera brindar variedad de sus productos  a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Dora va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa según la temporada, la Sra. Dora  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bibosi is made up of 8 members, 7 women and 1 man. The president of the bank is Dora, who is 26 years old and has two children, ages 1 and 9 years old. 

Dora works selling clothing. She has a stand in one of the busiest markets in the city of Santa Cruz. This loan is her 4th sequence with the institution.

Dora is going to use this loan to buy winter clothing such as pullovers and jackets thus providing a variety of products to her customers and increasing her earnings. Her reason for asking for this loan is to continue improving her business. Dora is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of seasonal clothing. Dora is a hard working person who feels happy for the opportunity as this is the only activity that permits her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 5 children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 26 years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her small clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and it will help her to generate greater profits and pay for her children's medical bills. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house on her other plot of land. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay is 26 years old and a humble villager living in Baray district with her husband and a young child. At home, Hay has been operating a small convenience shop, offering many types of products including  grocery items, snack foods, sweets, powders, canned food, noodles, and miscellaneous household things to local people in her community. She makes a suitable income of 4.00 USD per day, from which she can cover her daily costs. Hay’s husband manages a rice farm and also runs a recycling business for additional income.

Hay would like to help her husband in his recycling business due to his need for extra capital for the improvements. Hay decided to turn to HKL for her third time to gain access to financial assistance. She is asking for a KHR 400,000 loan to add to their existing money to use as working capital in buying  materials to recycle. Hay hopes that her income will be better though using the loan from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to use as working capital in buying materials to recycle.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 26 years old, married with two young sons. She is currently engaged in fishing with her husband in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is hopeful that she can make her business bigger someday by doing her best in her daily fishing activity. 

Haide needs help to improve her business. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy the needed materials like fish hooks, fishing nets and gasoline. This will help so her husband can work smoothly in his fishing. Her income will then be used for her family's healthy diet and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy materials like fish hooks, fishing nets and gasoline

loans.name: Fioleta

texts.en: Fioleta is 35 years old and got married to a man who is working in a hospital. She has two children; the elder one is in school. She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including sugar, candles, soap, and rice.  A working capital of $350 helped her to start this kiosk in 2011.  She wants to buy  a piece of land to build a bigger house or to make her kiosk bigger in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for her store

loans.name: Sector Vi Saquilla Group

texts.es:
La señora Petronila esta casad, tiene 27 años de edad, no tuv la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales estudia, se dedica a la venta de compra y venta de ropa típica, inicio este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien es guía de turismo, en el departamento donde viven.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar mas mercadería: chalinas, manteles de mesa, cabachas, camino de mesa que son adornos, y  otros. Espera en el futuro su negocio sea con mejores ganancias y pueda apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sis hijos.
texts.en:
Petronila is married. She is 27 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has two children and one of them is a student. She buys and sells traditional clothing. She began this business with the help of her husband who is a tour guide in the department where they live.

The group came about to ask for a loan to use to buy more merchandise: scarves, tablecloths, working shirts or aprons, embroidered table runners, and more. She hopes in the future that her business will have more earnings and that she can help her husband pay for the children’s education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to sell clothing

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Jam, aged 32, works for a garment factory in a suburb of Phnom Penh. He’s skilled in repairing the mechanical parts of sewing machines and other machines that have similar functions. His wife works in the same company with him, but she sews clothes. Together, they can earn a decent salary to support their living and to bring up their two school-aged children.

Jam and his wife want to own a motorcycle for commuting to their workplace in order to reduce their transportation costs. Jam is therefore requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to help make the purchase. In the future, he hopes to establish a general store for his wife to sell a variety of products in their village.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to support their transportation needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Helene Crescance

texts.fr: Hélène est une femme de 47 ans, mariée, mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 20 et 25 ans, tous trois vont à l'école. Elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gère depuis 10 ans déjà. Son activité fonctionne bien grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses compétences dans ce domaine.Hélène aimerait augmenter le stock de produits cosmétiques dans sa structure pour éviter que ses clients aillent à la concurrence. Elle aimerait aussi s'acheter un autre casque, un sèche cheveux et des chaises pour mettre ses clients plus à l'aise et être diligeante dans  ses services. Ceci améliorera la qualité de ses services et augmentera sa marge bénéficiaire.Elle réinvestira une partie de ses profits dans son activité dans le but d'ouvrir dans un futur proche un centre de soins esthétiques , et le reste lui permettra de satisfaire en partie les besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène is a married woman, 47 years old, who is the mother of three children, from 20 to 25 years old, all going to school. She opened a hair salon in her district in the capital. She has been running it for ten years already. Her business is doing well, thanks to her warm welcomes and her competence in this domain. 

Hélène would like to increase her stock of cosmetic products in her space, so as to prevent customers from going over to the competition. She would also like to buy another hair dryer and some chairs to accommodate her customers more and to be diligent in providing her services. This will improve the quality of her services and to increase her profit margin.

She will reinvest part of her profits into her business with the goal of opening a center of cosmetology in the near future. The rest of the profits will enable her in part to meet the day-to-day needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, a hair dryer, and chairs

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Rugiatu from Moriba town in the southern region of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with 3 children between the ages of 12 and 18 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 1998, Rugiatu established her beverage business. After her husband died during the war, there was no one to take care of her family, so she decided to start the business as a permanent source of income. She works every day, 15 hours a day. She says that the main challenge to her business is the high cost of transportation.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, stout, beer, and fruit wine. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, stout, beer, and fruit wine

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 29 years old. He is married to Margaret and together they have two children aged nine and two years. He has been in the retail business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

The loan will be used to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour to sell.The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his children. This is his second loan with KADET LTD, and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. His hope and dream is to own shops in Tala and Kangundo towns.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food to sell.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.en: A $1,000 loan is taken out by Olimpia; she is 52 years old. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan. There are 10 people in her family, eight children plus Olimpia and her husband. She started this business in 2008 with a working capital of $500. Her husband is a driver. She also has land to cultivate corn, bananas and vegetables.  She has a dream to buy a car because her husband is a driver and they can get more income for their family.

loans.use: to buy some additinal items for her store, including coffee and sugar

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Femme d’un retraité, Dédé est âgée de 54ans. Elle a 03 enfants (21, 18,15ans) tous sur les bancs de l’école.  Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle vend depuis 1996 des bazins et des lins à toutes personnes dans un marché de la place. Elle est reconnue dans la ville à cause de la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire chaque fois les clients quand ils font les demandes elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour augmenter son stock de  marchandises. Avec les profits réalisés, elle veut ouvrir une boutique à domicile, vendre en gros des bazins et assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
A retired woman, Dédé is 54 years old, and she has three children (21, 18, and 15 years old), all in school. To help out her husband with the household expenses, she has been selling damask and linen fabrics to anyone at the local market, since 1996. She is recognized in the city for the quality of her products. 

To satisfy her customers at all times when they put in their orders, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to increase her stock of merchandise. With the profits made, she wants to open a shop in her home, sell damask in bulk, and to cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy damask and linen fabrics

loans.name: Kodjosse

texts.fr: Père de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés, Mr Kodjosse âgé de 32ans a pour épouse une tresseuse. Il a pour profession reporteur photographe et exerce seul ce métier dans un studio. C’est en 2005 qu’il a ouvert son atelier et il s’y plait et a de nombreux clients  à cause de la perfection de son service rendu. Il sollicite un premier prêt dans notre institution   pour acheter un appareil numérique et un ordinateur. Il veut réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans l’activité, ouvrir un autre studio et prendre encore mieux soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
The father of three children, of whom two are in school, Mr. Kodjosse, aged 32, has a wife who is a hairdresser. He is a photo-journalist by profession working in this trade alone in a studio. He opened his workshop in 2005 and is happy there with numerous customers due to perfection in the services provided. 

He is requesting an initial loan from our institution to buy a digital camera and a computer. He wants to reinvest the extra profits into his business, open another studio, and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera and a computer

loans.name: Angel Jacinto

texts.es:
Ángel nacido en Chone actualmente vive con su esposa y dos hijos en Santo Domingo. Ángel tiene 33 años y inicio su negocio agrícola hace más o menos 3 años. Santo Domingo es una ciudad con bastantes oportunidades para montar negocios y crecer económicamente ya que por su ubicación central en el Ecuador actúa como puente entre la costa y la sierra lo que le ha llenado de comercio y turismo en los últimos años. 
Ángel trabaja de 8 a 10 horas al día para que su negocio salga adelante y para poder brindarles un mejor futuro y calidad de vida a sus hijos. Por lo tanto,  Ángel solicita un préstamo por primera vez  y si lo consigue pretende invertirlo en la compra de una máquina chapeadora (cortadora de césped). Con esta máquina Ángel podría trabajar a un ritmo más rápido lo que le permitiría terminar sus contratos más rápido y aceptar mas propuestas. Ángel considera que con esta máquina él podría aumentar sus ingresos lo que le permitiría mejorar la calidad de vida de él su esposa y sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Ángel was born in Chone. Currently he lives with his wife and two children in Santo Domingo. Ángel is 33 years old. He began his farming business about 3 years ago. Santo Domingo is a city with plenty of opportunities to start businesses and for economic growth as it is located in central Ecuador and serves as a bridge between the coast and mountain ranges and has been full of commerce and tourism in recent years.

Ángel works from 8 to 10 hours a day in order for his business to succeed and in order to provide a better future and quality of life for the children. So, Ángel is asking for a loan for the first time and upon getting it he wants to invest it in the purchase of a chapeadora (lawnmower). With this machine Ángel could work more rapidly permitting him to finish his contracts faster and accept more proposals. Ángel believes that with this machine he could increase his earnings thereby permitting him to improve the quality of life for himself, his wife, and the two children.

loans.use: to buy a chapeadora (lawnmower)

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 42 years old, married and blessed with three children, ages 21, 19 and 6 years old. She distributes diapers and sanitary towels to institutions – a business she started two years ago. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

Lydia has requested for a second loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more diapers and sanitary towels for distribution. The profit she earns will be ploughed back into her business. She hopes to do well in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more diapers, sanitary towels and tissue papers for distribution.

loans.name: Meat

texts.en:
Meat is from Kampot province, where he operates a farming business for his main income. He is 28 years old, married, and has two young kids. Meat's spouse works in the same type of business. This couple helps each other to maintain healthier crops and increase their revenue upon harvest. 

Meat aims to expand his business and grows various kinds of seasonal crops such as vegetables, beans and corn. Therefore, he will gradually work out his plans to achieve his goal. 

Recently, Meat has been involved in fishing for additional income, yet he doesn't own a boat for these activities. As a result, Meat would like to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a boat for fishing. Meat hopes that Kiva lenders will help him in improving his business as well as his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a boat for fishing.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old and married and has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing 29,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Helen has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from fishing. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kokui

texts.fr: Madame Kokui est âgée de 31ans. Pour se prendre en charge et se lancer dans la vie maritale plus tard, Madame Kokui a appris la couture. Après avoir terminé son apprentissage, elle a ouvert un atelier. En plus de la couture, elle vend des pagnes et elle est aidée par une de ses sœurs. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite dans notre institution un  prêt pour s’acheter de la machine. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité et être une couturière de renom.
texts.en: Ms. Kokui is 31 years old. To support herself and to get married later, she learned how to sew. After finishing her apprenticeship, she opened a workshop. In addition to sewing, she sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and she is helped by one of her sisters. To respond better to the needs of her customers, Ms. Kokui is requesting a loan from our institution to buy a sewing machine. She wants to reinvest in her business and be a renowned dressmaker.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Agée de 36ans, Madame Edwige est mariée à un magasinier. Ils ont ensemble 04 enfants dont 02 sur les bancs de l’école. L’ainé a 16ans et le dernier 10 mois. Elle est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1990. Cette activité qu’elle mène dans une boutique lui permet de se prendre en charge et d’aider son mari dans les charges du ménage. avec ce prêt qu’elle sollicite dans notre institution, elle va acheter des marchandises pour bien répondre aux désirs des clients. Avec les profits, elle veut épargner pour achever son chantier, devenir grossiste et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en:
Ms. Edwige, aged 36, is married to a shopkeeper. Together they have four children, of whom two are in school. The oldest is 16 years old, and the youngest is 10 months old. Ms. Edwige has been a retailer of grocery items since 1990. This business she runs in a shop enables her to support herself and to help her husband with household expenses. 

With this loan she is requesting from our institution, she is going to buy some merchandise to respond well to the wishes of her customers. With the profits, she wants to save money in order to finish rebuilding, become a wholesaler, and establish financial stability in her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is a lady, age 34 years old. She is married to Cyprian, who contributes additional income to the family, and they have two children. She has been in the green grocery business for eight years and currently earns a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings. This loan will be used to purchase stock for her business such as tomatoes, kale and onions. The anticipated profits will be used to educate her children. This is her second loan with KADET and she has successfully repaid the previous loan. Her hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy stock of assorted vegetables such as kale, tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Ladie

texts.en:
Ladie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetables business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell. Ladie has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from selling rice. 

Ladie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Los Amigasos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS AMIGASOS  Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Cinthia tiene 18 años, tiene dos hijos de la edades de 2 años  y un bebe de 4 meses. La Sra. Cinthia se dedica a la  actividad de venta de ropa, ella tiene su puesto de venta en la localidad de El Torno, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Cinthia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada de invierno  como chompas y chamarras  y así de esta manera brindar variedad de sus productos  a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Cinthia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa según la temporada, la Sra. Cinthia  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Amigasos is made up of 9 members, 8 women and 1 man. The president of the bank is Cinthia who is 18 years old. She has 2 children who are 2 years old and a baby of 4 months.

Cinthia works selling clothing. She has a stand in the town of El Torno. This is her first loan sequence within the institution. Cinthia is going to use this loan to buy winter clothing such as pullovers and jackets thus providing a variety of products to her customers and increasing her earnings. Her reason for asking for this loan is to continue improving her business. Cinthia is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of clothing according to the season. Cinthia is a hardworking woman who feels happy for the opportunity as it is the only activity which allows her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: Patrice est un homme de 35ans,marié et père d'un enfant de 4mois,il est commercant et a ouvert une structure dans laquelle il vend des produits cosmétiques depuis 12 ans déjà.Grace à son accueil chaleureux,ses bons conseils et son expérience dans ce domaine,il a conquis et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps.L'augmentation de cette clientèle rend l'offre inférieure à la demande d'ou la rupture permanente de ses stocks due a la petitesse de son capital. Grace à ses crédits Patrice augmentera le stock de ses produits cosmétiques ce qui  lui évitera des ruptures de stocks, satisfera sa clientèle, augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire;Il réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et économisera le reste pour les études futures de son enfant.
texts.en:
Patrice is a 35-year-old man who is married and the father of a 4-month-old child. He is a merchant and has opened a space in which he has been selling cosmetic products for twelve years already. Thanks to his warm welcomes, his good advice, and his experience in this domain, he won over a loyal customer base, which is growing over the course of time. The increased number of customers means the supply falls short of demand, and so he is continuously low on investory due to his meager capital.

Thanks to his loans, Patrice will increase his stock of cosmetics, which will prevent inventory shortages, satisfy his customers, and increase his sales and thus his profit margin. He will reinvest part of his profits into his business and save the rest for his child's education.

loans.use: to increase his stock of cosmetic products

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 63 years old and widowed with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilia has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from running a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Veuve de 37ans, madame Abra a 02 enfants, tous à l’école. Pour subvenir aux besoins des enfants, elle vend des bijoux et des pagnes à ses clients de façon ambulante. Elle manque de fonds pour s’approvisionner en marchandises c’est pour cela elle fait appel à notre institution. Elle veut avoir une boutique pour mieux vendre et bien prendre en charge les enfants.
texts.en: A 37-year-old widow, Ms. Abra as two children, both in school. To meet the needs of her children, she sells jewelry and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) to her customers door to door. She lacks the funds for stocking up on merchandise. This is why she turned toward our institution. She wants to have a shop for having better sales and really supporting the children.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth and jewelry

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel esta solicitando un crédito con nosotros para hacer los pagos de  colegiaturas, así  como comprar el material escolar que sus hijos necesitaran para la escuela, ya que esta muy próximo el regreso a clases.
Los hijos de Doña María Isabel podrán seguir con sus estudios y estarán  preparados para dar un buen desempeño en la escuela.
Ella trabaja en limpieza de  una casa  y su esposo el señor José Roberto es empleado de una fábrica en el aria de producción.
Estos son los ingresos que tiene para su familia y con los cuales un parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
María Isabel is asking for a loan with us in order to pay school fees, and to buy school supplies that her children need for school as they return to classes very soon, so Marīa Isabel’s children could continue with their studies and be prepared to perform well in school.

She works as a housekeeper and her husband, José Roberto is a factory worker in the area of production. This is the way they make a living, a part of which will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to pay school expenses

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran is married with two sons. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. Saran’s business is raising pigs and producing rice wine. Her husband assists his wife in the business. 
One of Saran’s sons has full-time employment and another one attends school. 

Saran hopes to continue her business of raising pigs and producing rice wine because it is her main source of income. Hence, she decided to apply for another loan to purchase 10 more piglets and pig feed, and to buy rice for making rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase 10 more piglets and pig feed, and to buy rice for making rice wine.

loans.name: Nenitha

texts.en: Nenitha is 40 years old and married with five children, three in school. Nenitha works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Nenitha has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other grocery items. In the future, Nenitha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marieta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marieta is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.
Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 46 years old and married with 4 children.

Marlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Marlene has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and electronic re-loading.

Marlene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Enny

texts.en: Enny is 29 years old, she is getting married to a man who is also in business. She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including flour, oil, soap, and vegetables.  She has been doing this activity since 2011. She started with working capital of $200.00. She wants her kiosk to become a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies including flour, oil, soap, and vegetables.

loans.name: Segundo Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre de 65 años nacido en Alausí pero que reside en Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo es una de las ciudades grandes de Ecuador y cuenta con clima tropical húmedo. La ciudad actúa como puente crucial entre la costa y la sierra, motivo por el cual ha experimentado un rápido crecimiento en las últimas décadas. Santo Domingo se sustenta principalmente a través de la agricultura y el comercio. El crecimiento económico por el que paso Santo Domingo ha hecho surgan diferentes motores económicos lo que ha tenido un efecto positivo en la sociedad.
Enrique inicio su negocio hace poco mas de 10 años, y ha tenido bastante éxito desde entonces, el actualmente está buscando un crédito para poder invertir en maquinaria, quiere comprar una sierra circular que le ayudaría a realizar los cortes y diseños de manera más rápida. Enrique trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias pero considera que ha llegado el punto en el cual podría invertir más para poder crecer y mejorar sus ingresos. La meta final de Enrique es montar su propio taller con buena ubicación y servicios y productos variados.
texts.en:
Enrique, 65, was born in Alausí but lives in Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo is one of Ecuador's largest cities and has a humid climate. It is strategically located between the coast and the mountains, and, therefore, has experienced rapid growth in recent decades. Farming and commerce are the city's principal activities, and its economic growth has spurred a variety of sectors that have enriched the community.

Enrique started his business 10 years ago and has enjoyed considerable success. He is requesting a loan to invest in machinery, in particular, a circular saw to help him cut and create wood designs faster. Enrique works on average 8 hours a day, but he feels he has reached the point at which he must invest to grow and increase his income. His goal is to open a well-stocked workshop in a good location.

loans.use: to invest in machinery, in particular, a circular saw to help him cut and create wood designs faster.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Vun is a 28-year-old married man. He peacefully lives with his wife and three children in Ang Snoul District, Kandal Province. Vun is employed on the sales staff of a company that offers farm supplies in Phnom Penh. He gets paid monthly but he also can earn a daily wage due to his good communication with existing and new customers. Vun is glad that his wife supports him in generating income to uplift their living conditions by being dedicated to a farming and livestock-raising business.

Vun would like to obtain a loan in the amount of 1,500 USD to purchase construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand, and zinc to renovate his present house. Vun hopes to have a suitable home for his family. For his business goal, Vun anticipates that he can own a big poultry farm in his village someday.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand, and zinc to renovate his present house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. Mercedita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts to repair her motorcycle transport. Mercedita has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair her motorcycle transport

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco habitante de Colonia Talolinga desde hace  5 años tiene establecido su propio negocio de Laboratorio Dental el cual se encuentra ubicado en su misma localidad de residencia, este joven brinda servicio en todo tipo de trabajos dentales, actividad que se constituye como su principal fuente de  ingreso para el bienestar de su familia, su esposa  colabora en los quehaceres del hogar, nesecita este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construccion, para realizar un pozo lo que incluye excabacion, brocal, caseta y bomba lo que le permitira tener agua en todo tiempo, garantizando gozar de mejores condiciones de vida, espera ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva la llevar a cabo su proyecto.
texts.en:
Five years ago, Francisco, a resident of Colonia Talolinga, started his own business, Laboratorio Dental, in his home. He offer all types of dental services, which is his family's main source of income. His wife attends to the household chores.

Francisco needs this loan for materials and equipment to build a well, including excavating and placing the parapet, stall, and pump so that there is always a water supply, which provides better living conditions for his family. He hopes to undertake this project with support from Kiva microfinance lenders.

loans.use: to build a well.

loans.name: Cynthia Estefanía

texts.es:
Cynthia vive en Quininde. Este cantón está en la provincia de Esmeraldas, ubicada en la Costa Norte del Ecuador. En la historia ha sido un buen proveedor de banano, café y cacao y actualmente es uno de los mayores productores de palma africana y recursos forestales. Quinide cuenta con un clima tropical lluvioso. La ciudad tiene 150000 habitantes. La ciudad tiene un ecosistema bastante diverso por lo tanto tiene varias reservas ecológicas. 
Con tan solo 20 años, Cynthia ya tiene su propio negocio de venta de maquillaje a catálogo. Ella decidió crear este emprendimiento hace dos años y poco a poco lo hice su mayor fuente de ingresos. Cynthia tiene fe en su negocio y quiere que crezca para tener una fuente de ingresos más estable. Cythia terminó sus estudios secundarios y quiere poder continuar con sus superiores, por lo tanto pide un préstamo a Kiva para poder comprar más productos y reducir el costo unitario de cada uno. Así, ella podrá ahorrar para cumplir sus sueños a futuro.
texts.en:
Cynthia lives in Quininde, a canton of Esmeraldas province located along Ecuador's north coast. The area, which historically produced banana, coffee, and cacao, is now one of the main producers of African palm oil and forestry products. Quinide has a tropical, rainy climate; 15000 residents; and a diverse ecosystem and several ecological reserves.

Though she is just 20, Cynthia has her own business, selling makeup through catalogs, which she started two years ago and has slowly become a great income source. Cynthia has faith in her business and wants to grow it so that it provides more stable income. She finished secondary school and wishes to continue her studies. She is requesting a loan to to purchase more products at lower costs, which will allow her to save and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more products at lower costs.

loans.name: Las Joyitas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Las Joyitas” está conformado por 15 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, venta de joyas, venta de manzanas, pasteles, venta de lanas, feriantes, venta de leña, servicios entre otro. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Sylvia, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color café, lleva una cartera de color café, alrededor de  su cuello usa una bufanda de color blanco, en sus manos sostiene una carpeta y su cabello lo usa tomado y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio específicamente en cafetería, desde hace 15 años. Se desempeña en sus labores de lunes a viernes desde las 08ºº hasta las 15ºº horas.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en supermercados y distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un letrero para su local.
Una de las metas de Sylvia es vender 3 veces más la cantidad habitual de sus cafés, tiene bastante clientela, pero quiere seguir captando para  crecer aún más, para generar mayores ingresos, ya que con estos recursos apoya al hogar y el bienestar de su hija.
Sylvia vive junto a su marido y su hija de 11 años de edad. Uno de sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener la posibilidad de viajar con su hija fuera del país.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que es  muy unido y existe generosidad.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Las Joyitas and is made up of 15 entrepreneurs who work as merchants, specifically selling clothes, jewelry, apples, cakes, wool, traveling sales, firewood, and other services. All of them live in Temuco.

Sylvia is a member of the communal bank and can be found in the photograph standing in the front row, 4th person from right to left, wearing a brown jacket, with a brown purse, with a white scarf around her neck, holding a folder in her hands, and her dark brown hair pulled back.

She has been working in the field of commerce, specifically in food service, for 15 years. She works Monday through Friday from 8:00AM until 3:00PM. She usually buys her food at supermarkets and distributors at a low cost, which is financially desirable. With the loan she will buy a sign for her facility.

One of Sylvia’s goals is to sell 3 times the usual amount of her sales. She has enough customers, but she wants to continue attracting more in order to grow and in order to generate more profits as these resources support the household and the welfare of her daughter.

Silvia lives with her husband and her daughter who is 11 years old. One of her dreams for the family is to have the possibility to travel with her daughter outside the country. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza since it permits her to invest in her business. In regards to the communal bank of which she is a member, she says that it is very close-knit and generous.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile). The surrounding area contains a number of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and native flora and fauna which is very stunning, concentrated in nearby nature parks. It should be pointed out that 50% of the Mapuche indigenous people of our country live in this region.

loans.use: to buy a sign for her facility

loans.name: Juan Bento

texts.es: El sr Juan esta  casado con norma Leticia desde ya casi 30 años, tienen un  negocio de abarrotes  y con su negocio lleva ya 10 años de servicio. En esta ocasión solicita que se le apoye para comprar más mercancía para su negocio ya que quiere expandir a mas variedad en productos a ofrecer a sus clientes porque la competencia es muy fuerte y necesita para poder seguir teniendo ingresos para solventar sus gastos. Su esposa ha estado a su lado durante todo este tiempo apoyando el negocio familiar ya que es una forma de convivir y pasar tiempo juntos.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan has been married to Norma Leticia for almost 30 years. They have a grocery store business and have been providing service to customers for 10 years. At this time, he is applying for assistance in purchasing more merchandise for his business since he wants to expand his inventory to include a greater variety of products for his clients because the competition is fierce and he needs to continue earning an income to pay expenses.

His wife has been at his side during all of this time, both to support the family business and because this is a way for them to spend time together.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina es una mujer de 64 años, ella es casada con Ramiro de 77 años. Actualmente los dos viven en Santo Domingo y mantienen a tres hijos. Santo Domingo es una ciudad de clima tropical cálido, ubicada en el centro de Ecuador uniendo la costa y la sierra a través de la cordillera. Santo Domingo ha experimentado un crecimiento económico bastante acelerado en los últimos años lo que a su vez ha creado oportunidades de trabajo inexistentes anteriormente, sin embargo debido a esto también ha crecido mucho el crimen, y en los últimos años se ha notado la presencia del narcotráfico y el sicariato.
En medio de esta ciudad surgen Celina y Ramiro, Celina solicita un préstamo por primera vez, ella tiene una pequeña finca donde crece diferentes cultivos. Celina considera que ha llegado el momento en el cual puede invertir un poco para crecer su capacidad y hacer ciertos arreglos necesarios. Celina actualmente trabaja un promedio de diez horas al día, pero con este préstamo si lo consigue va a lograr expandir su capacidad y mejorar sus ingresos para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Celina is a 64 years old woman, married with Ramiro who is 77 years old. Currently, the two live in Santo Domingo and support three children. 

Santo Domingo is a city of warm tropical climate, located in central Ecuador, linking the coast and the mountains through a mountain range. Santo Domingo has experienced a very rapid economic growth in the last years, which in turn has created job opportunities, non-existent previously. However, because of that, crime has also grown. In recent years, there's been the presence of drug trafficking and contract killings.

In the middle of this city is where Celina and Ramiro appear. Celina is applying for a loan for the first time. She has a small farm where she cultivates different crops. Celina believes that now is the time to invest a little to improve her capacity and make certain repairs. Celina currently works an average of ten hours per day. With the loan, she hopes to expand her capacity and improve her income for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to make some repairs

loans.name: Grace Veronica

texts.es: Grace es una madre luchadora y emprendedora la cual inicio su negocio empujada por la necesidad de brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Es en el sector de la Isla Trinitaria donde tiene su restaurant el cual atiende con la ayudad de sus hijos. Escogió esta actividad porque le gusta cocinar porque investigo dándose cuenta que deja mejores ganancias que cualquier otro negocio. Su horario de atención es el normal desde las 8 de la mañana ofreciendo desayunos hasta las 3 de la tarde, no se queda más tiempo porque le podría resultar peligroso y no le gustaría que la delincuencia la vea como blanco de robos. Los platos que más le solicitan es el pollo frito, pescado frito y carne asada los cuales vende a $ 2.00 el plato. Como fue hace varios años que inicio su negocio le gustaría reformar un poco el área de la cocina es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar una cocina nueva industrial, ollas, colas. Su sueño a futuro es poder abrir 2 locales comerciales propios uno para cada unos de sus hijos y que continúen con el negocio por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking, enterprising mother who started her business because she wanted to offer her children a brighter future. Her restaurant, which she manages with her children's help, is located in Isla Trinitaria. She chose this business because she loves to cook and it generates more profit than any other. The business usually opens at 8 a.m. for breakfast and closes at 3 p.m. It is dangerous to stay open later; it bothers Grace to see crimes in the area like robbery. 

Fried chicken, fried seafood, and grilled meats, which she offers at $2 each, are her most popular dishes. Since she started her business some years ago, she would like to remodel the kitchen. She is requesting a loan to buy a new industrial stove, pots, and pans. She dreams of opening 2 more locations, one for each of her children, and to keep growing her business for many years.

loans.use: to buy a new industrial stove, pots, and pans.

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is 43 years old and from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her eldest is 18 and the youngest is 10. 

She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for five years now. She sells basic household items like candies, rice, school supplies, seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and toiletries to the people in her community. She usually earns 3,000 PHP per month.

She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies of candies, rice, school supplies, seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and toiletries, of which she sells the most on a daily basis. 

In the future, Alyn hopes to make her store bigger and offer more merchandise to her customers for a better income.

loans.use: to buy candies, rice, school supplies, seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and toiletries.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca ha mantenido por mas de 15 años su negocio de taquitos mañaneros, es un buen negocio por la gran demanda, actualmente casada  con dos hijos que aun están estudiando secundaria, razon por la cual quiere luchar cada dia mas y mas. Y esta vez decidio hacer un proyecto a corto plazo el cual es la compra mas mercancia para asi poder ofrecerles a sus comensales mas variedad y a la vez mantener los gastos escolares al corriente y a sus hijos no le falte nada.
texts.en: For over 15 years, Francisca has operated a business serving taquitos mañaneros [morning tacos], for which demand is excellent.  She is married, and her two children attend secondary school, which means she has to work harder each day. Now she has decided to undertake a short-term project, purchasing more merchandise so that she can offer greater variety to her customers, keep her education expenses current, and provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for tacos.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years of age, married, and has only one child. Her husband is an overseas Filipino worker in Canada. With the help of her husband, they are able to educate their only child and sustain their daily needs.

Jocelyn would like to earn independently, so she focuses herself on running her handicraft business. At this time, she has four helpers in making home-made plastic baskets, shoulder bags, and fruit trays. She is really grateful because of the blessings she has. According to her, she is able to make six shoulder bags and ten fruit trays a day.  

Her business is growing, so she is also in need of additional capital to develop the quality of her products and to make more stock. With her determination in life, she is requesting additional capital amounting to PHP 35,000. She hopes to obtain this amount to be able to increase her income and employ more people to work with her handicraft business.

loans.use: to buy more plastic straps for her home-made handicrafts basket business.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn (pictured here), age 57, makes and sells typical Cambodian cake in front of a garment factory. Her husband, Sam Oeun, age 46, is a farmer and raises cows at home. 

They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have four children, one son and three daughters. One is married and lives separately, two attend school, and another one assists in her mother’s business. 

Yorn is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom (in the photo) is 27 years old and her husband, Kamsun, is 30 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, and they have two young children, one son and one daughter. 

Yom is a garment worker, while her husband is hired to grow mushrooms and gets paid with fees.

Yom is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a married mother of three children ages 18, 22 and 27, is from the town of Talibon, Bohol where she and her husband work together in their fishing business to earn an income.

Now requesting a loan to pay for gasoline for their boat, fish hooks and fishing net repairs, Rosita plans to expand their business and acquire boats to earn a better income in order to better support the family's needs for food and school fees.

loans.use: to pay for fish hooks, fishing net repairs, and gasoline for their boat.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 49 years of age and has four children. All her children have finished their education through the profit gained from her direct selling business.

Juliet runs and has operated her direct selling business for three years. With her patience and hard work, she is able to sustain their basic commodities in life. Aside from direct selling, she has also involved herself in a hog raising business. 

Juliet would like to add more products such as shoes, cosmetics, and clothing to her stall, but her income is not enough due to her expenses in her hog raising business. So, she is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 50,000. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan. 

She believes that through this requested loan, she will be able to provide good quality service to her customers and be able to encourage more customers to buy her products. In this way, she could gain more income to sustain her family’s daily needs and save some for emergency purposes when she got weak.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business through putting up another branch near her village.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as shoes, cosmetics, and clothing for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria Jose de 43 años de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, tiene por actividad económica el servicio de moto taxi ( que consisten trasportar a las personas con un asiento en la parte delantera de la moto), el negocio lo tiene hace 2 años que  surgió la idea, ya que se agrupo con uno vecinos y formaron una cooperativa de dicho servicio, en la actualidad el negocio se ha incrementado gracias a la aceptación de la ciudadanía ya que le resulta un medio de transporte mas económico, su sueños y metas es llegar a formar a sus dos hijos ya que en la actualidad están estudiando en la universidad. El financiamiento lo necesita para darle mantenimiento a los moto taxi y brindar un mejor servicio a la población.
texts.en: Maria Jose is forty-three years old, married, and has two children who are of age. For work she offers a motor rickshaw service (that consists of transporting people with a seat in the front part of the motor rickshaw. She's had the business for two years when the idea emerged after she got together with some neighbors and they formed a cooperative providing said service. Currently the business has grown thanks to its acceptance by the citizens as it's a cheaper means of transport. Her dreams and goals are to educate her two children since they are currently studying in college. She needs the funding to provide maintenance for the motor rickshaws and offer better service to the population.

loans.use: to buy and provide maintenance for her motor rickshaw and offer better service to the population.

loans.name: Ma. Celiet

texts.en:
Ma. Celiet is a 29 year-old married woman from the town of Talibon in the province of Bohol. She has two children, ages eight and nine.
