texts.es: La señora Justina es Maestra de Primaria de  Profesión, actualmente se desempeña como Docente  de un centro educativo de una comunidad de larreynaga,  es soltera con 3 hijos  a los que tiene  que mantener las condiciones de desarrollo profesional, actualmente la señora Justina  tiene una necesidad muy importante en lo que se refiere al mejoramiento de  un cuarto,  para ese efecto tomo la decisión de visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiado con crédito para efectuar su gestión de mejoras en el objetivo planteado, con mira a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida familiar, ya que dicho financiamiento será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, ladrillo rojo, hierro 3/8, hierro liso, cemento, piedrín, arena y mano de obra, para mejorar las condiciones de la familia.
texts.en: Justina is a primary school teacher; she currently holds the position of Docent in an education center for a community in Larreynaga. She is single with 3 children, for whom she has to maintain professional conditions of development. At this time, Justina has a very important need regarding the improvement of a bedroom. To this end, she made the decision to visit the CEPRODEL offices so she could benefit from a loan to carry out her proposed goal, with the intention of improving her family’s condition and standard of living. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as metal roofing, red bricks, perforated bricks, 3/8 inch iron, solid iron rods, cement, gravel, sand, and manpower, in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase metal roofing, red bricks, perforated bricks, 3/8 inch iron, solid iron rods, cement, gravel, sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. He owns a grocery shop, a business that he has been operating for ten years. He started the business through his personal savings.
He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high transport and fuel costs and seasonal weather changes.
Kenga is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of groceries e.g. bags of potatoes, cabbages etc. He will use the extra income from the loan to pay for his children’s school fees. His future plan is to become the supplier of the area.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of groceries e.g. bags of potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Erika Patricia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Pradera en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de año y medio  de edad. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias. Ella tiene que llevarle a su pequeño hijo cuando realiza sus ventas ya que no tiene donde dejarle lo cual es un poco incomodo pero aun así lo hace ya que a su esposo no le alcanza cubrir todos los gastos del hogar.  Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Triunfadoras meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of La Pradera in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year round and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many touristic attractions.

Here lives Erika, she is 24 years old and has a relationship of cohabitation, with a son who is one year and a half old. Her husband is a merchant. She is a housewife and in order to obtain her own resources to be able to help her husband with the household expenses she sells clothes of all kinds and products of Lebel (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She works three days a week for two to three hours daily. 

She has to take her young son when she goes selling because she doesn't have any place where to leave him. It's a little uncomfortable but she still does it because what her husband earns is not enough to cover the household expenses. She leaves her products on credit and charges every eight days. She has been doing it for over three years and is doing very well, what she sells more are cosmetics, because they are very good. 

The loan is to buy clothes, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. She has been in the Communal Bank for a year and she likes it because payments are easy to make. Her dreams are to go on in her business while improving her life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Philippiens 4:6 Plus Group

texts.en:
Lussambo 58, widow, is a leader of the community bank named “Philippiens 4:6 Plus” which is composed of 12 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 
Lussambo runs a restaurant. With the first loan from Hope, she has expanded her business by adding beverages in high demand where she works in western Kinshasa. She makes the equivalent of US$150 per week in profit. She has been a faithful Hope’s client, having two times obtained and correctly repaid her loans. Since then her business has prospered. With the coming loan, Lussambo is planning to increase the stock of her restaurant by purchasing fish, chickens, and some crates of soft drinks that her clients need. She is working very hard and would like to continue receiving Hope loans in order to achieve her dreams of modernizing her restaurant by using electrical appliances such as hot plates instead of charcoal.  She also plans to open a large shop. Lussambo has two children aged 27 and 45 years old. They are both independent.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her restaurant by purchasing fish, chickens and some crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Nancy Lastenia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Pradera en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos son  mayores de edad, la menor  estudian en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
 
Ella para poder aportar para los gastos del hogar y para los estudios de su hija se dedica a la venta de productos Avon, Yanbal y Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), también vende productos naturales y los domingos prepara almuerzos para vender. A ella le gusta trabajar para poder salir adelante y sobre todo lo hace por el bienestar de su familia. Trabaja todos los días en todas sus actividades que  las viene realizando desde hace siete años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y productos naturales. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con  los créditos.
 
Su sueño es ver que su hija menor  termine sus estudios y sea un gran  profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Triunfadoras (Victorious Women) meets every 15 days in the community La Pradera in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented at all times of the year, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

In this place lives Nancy, who is 50 years old and married. From this relationship she has four children. Three of them are older; the youngest studies in high school, and she still lives at home. Her husband is a driver. 

In order to contribute to the home expenses and to her daughter’s schooling, she works selling products from Avon, Yanbal, and Esika (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and other accessories for women). She also sells natural products, and on Sundays she prepares lunches to sell.  She likes working to be able to get ahead; above all, she does it for the well-being of her family. She works every day on all her activities that she has carried out for seven years, and it’s going very well for her. 

This loan is to purchase perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, and natural products. She has been a part of the Communal Bank for two years, and she likes it because of the help that they have given with the loans. 

Her dream is to see her youngest daughter finish her studies and become a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, and natural products.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Mohamed from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with two children between the ages of 6 and 12 years old. His children are currently attending school. He also has two relative at home. 

Mohamed runs a general merchandise business within a busy market area. He sells rice, zinc and cement. He has been running this business for 18 years. He works at the business from 7:30 am until 6:00 pm, seven days per week. He says his business is the only source of income he has. He described his major problem as transportation.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy more variety of stock such as rice, zinc, and cement. The extra income from this loan will allow him to expand his business and educate his children. In the future, he plans to be a distributor to another partner. He appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mohamed from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more stock such as rice, zinc, and cement.

loans.name: Nigadi

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Nigadi from Grassfield in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 18 and 28 years old. Two of her children are current attending school.

Nigadi runs a general merchandise store where she sells rice, sugar, flour, milk, cheese, and biscuits. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business seven days per week. She receives additional income from renting out the house her husband built. She says that the main challenges to her business are weather conditions and a shortage of goods.

Nigadi has requested a loan to buy more rice, sugar, flour, milk, cheese, and biscuits. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to grow to a level of admiration. She appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Nigadi from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, flour, milk, cheese, and biscuits.

loans.name: Silvia Petrona

texts.es: Silvia Patricia  de 45 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de chatarra experiencia de tener el negocio 9 años el cual consiste en la compra y venta de chatarra como: hierro, cobre, aluminio, entre otros. El negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio y de forma ambulante, el objetivo del préstamo es invertir en el negocio para mejorar las ganancias, ya es parte de sus sueños y metas mejorar el negocio y los ingresos.
texts.en: Silvia Patricia is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. Her business is buying and selling scrap metal. She has 9 years of experience in the business, which consists of buying and selling scrap metals such as: iron, copper, and aluminum, among others. Her business is located in her house, and she also works as a street vendor. The goal of the loan is to invest in the business to improve her earnings. Her dream and goal is to improve the business and her income.

loans.use: to buy iron, copper, aluminum, and other metals.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in the Kongowehea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is single. He owns a retail shop, a business he has been operating for two years. Apart from this, he earns a salary from his transport business. The area has no electricity network.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is the high prices of the commodities and his inability to do business for longer hours.

Alex is applying for a loan of 14,196 Kenya shillings to purchase a solar panel. He believes this will enable him to do business in the late evening and charge mobile phones in the remote area where he lives. His plan for the future is to open another retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Alhassa

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Alhassa from Waterloo in the eastern area of Sierra Leone. He is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 12 years old. Two of his children are currently attending school. In 2000, Alhassa established his business. He sells bags, shoes, jeans and clothes around a busy market area. He began his business because he was out of a job and he needed a permanent income to support his children's schooling. He works at the business every day of the week. He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and the high rate of thievery and other crime in the community   .

Alhassa requires a loan in order to buy more bags, shoes, jeans and clothes. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and increase his capital. In the future, Alhassa plans to be become a wholesaler. He thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Alhassa from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more bags, shoes, jeans and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Yader Tomas

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de león, originario de una comarca aledaña  El señor yader es Felizmente  Casado, de profesión Productor Agropecuario ejerce las dos actividades es un señor emprendedor, con 3 hijos  a su cargo, al  que tiene el deber de mantener sus estudios, ya que trabaja en conjunto en los tiempos libres dedicándose apoyar  en las diferentes actividades , tiene 15 años de ejercerlas
Desde que inicio su negocio,  El señor se dedica mayormente como rubro mas importe la producción de leche, con la que por años ha sido la fuente económica más viable para el desarrollo  familiar y económico lo que le ha permitido mejorar sus condiciones, una de las necesidades más importantes es la de establecer pasto mejorado y mejorar las cercas, por el cual visito las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y ser beneficiada para lograr el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones y por ende el nivel de la familia.
texts.en:
Yader is from a small town in the municipality of Telica, in the department of León. He is happily married and is a small farmer and rancher. He is an enterprising person. He has 3 children and has the responsibility of providing them with schooling. They work together during their free times and help each other with the various tasks. He has been doing this for 15 years.

Since he was a boy, Yader has worked in the important business of milk production. For years, this has been the most viable source of income for his family and has allowed him to improve their conditions. One of the biggest needs is to establish improved forage grass and to improve the fences. In order to do this, he visited the offices of Ceprodel to request financing and benefits for achieving his goal of improving the conditions and therefore his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to plant Toledo Variety grass, to buy seed, to pay for planting; to buy barbed wire, staples, fence posts, and to pay for labor for putting up the fences.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Pradera en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Aquí vive la señora Ana, tiene 37 años  de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tiene una hija de 12 años de edad la misma que  estudia en colegio. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que la institución le ha brindado.

Para sacar adelante a su hija ella se dedica a la venta ropa, productos naturales y productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  deja a crédito y cobra cada 15 días, esto lo viene realizando desde hace cinco  años y  le ha ido muy bien, esta es la forma como ella puede sacar adelante a  su hija y a ella misma.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos naturales, ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas.

Su sueño es que su hija sea una gran profesional es por eso que ella lucha todos los días.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Triunfadoras” communal bank meets every 15 days in the La Pradera neighborhood in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are very popular in all seasons of the year. It is also known for being a town of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Ana lives. She is 37 years old and divorced. She has a daughter who is 12 years old and who is studying in high school. Ana has been with her communal bank for four loan cycles and she likes it because of the assistance and benefits that the institute has provided.

In order to provide for her daughter, she sells clothing, natural products, and Avon products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women). She works three days per week, usually in the mornings because that’s when it’s easiest for her to make her rounds. Her sales are door-to-door. She sells on credit and then collects her money every 15 days. She has been doing this for five years and it has gone very well for her. This is how she is able to provide for her daughter and for herself.

She will use this loan to buy natural products, clothing, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and lotions. 

Her dream is for her daughter to be a successful professional and that is why she works hard every day.

loans.use: to buy natural products, clothing, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and lotions.

loans.name: Darli Maria

texts.es: En el municipio de Telica departamento de león, originario de una comarca aledaña  La  señora Darli  es Felizmente  Casado, de profesión Productor Pecuario  ganado menor , crianza de cerdos es una señora emprendedora, con 3 hijos  a su cargo, al  que tiene el deber de mantener sus estudios, esta señora tiene 1 año de experiencia en el manejo de crianza de cerdos, a los cuales le ha visto buenas perspectivas, ya que con la utilidades   al final de la actividad ha mejorado su vivienda, su marido tiene una profesión de Radio Técnico actividad que le `proporciono inicialmente apoyándola económicamente, hoy en día esta señora  Darli, tiene una necesidad de efectuar una inversión más consolidada y tomo la decisión de visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento para la compra de 4 cerdos, concentrado, vitaminas y desparasitante para    producir de manera más técnica,  y de esa manera obtener otros ingresos y ayudarle a los gastos del hogar a su marido y mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica, department of León, from a region of villages, Darli is happily married. She works as a livestock producer of cattle, rearing pigs. 

She is an entrepreneur, with three dependent children, who she has to maintain studying. She has one year of experience rearing pigs, and she saw it as promising because with the earnings from the activity she was able to improve her home. Her husband works as a radio technician, activity that allowed him to initially support her financially. 

Today, Darli needs a more consolidated investment so she took the decision to visit the offices of Ceprodel to be granted with funding to buy four pigs, concentrate, vitamins and deworming to produce in a more professional way. Doing so, she will obtain other income to help her husband with the household expenses and will improve her living conditions and level of life.

loans.use: to buy four pigs, concentrate, vitamins, and deworming

loans.name: Tarika

texts.en:
Tarika is in her early sixties and retired; she is married and has four children. She lives in a major city in the southeastern part of the country. Her retirement is so small that she cannot even feed herself; this was the reason that some five years back, she started operating a fast food restaurant with the hope that she would make some income. The business has been going good so far and this keeps her going; she said smiling. There is a demand for her services and she has established a good clientele amongst the residents in the neighborhood.  Now, she wants to expand, and for this, she is requesting a loan to purchase inventory items.

This will be her second loan with the previous one being paid off on time. Tarika’s application had been on the waiting list at the VisionFund Albania institution for some time. Recently, she was told that she was eligible to request a Kiva loan instead. Since then, she has been buzzing with excitement.

loans.use: To purchase inventory items for her fast food restaurant.

loans.name: Protain

texts.en: Protain is 25 years old. He is married and has one child who is four. He sells jean trousers. He has been in this business for the past eight years. With the loan, he will buy more jeans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house for his family's residence.

loans.use: to buy more men's trousers to sell.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.fr: Mr augustin est célibataire. Âgé de 23ans, il se bat chaque fois pour garantir un avenir à lui et à ses futures progénitures. Il est revendeur de pommades, de savons, et d’autres produits pour le corps. Son approvisionnement se fait généralement à Lomé et il revend à SOKODE, une ville située à environ 380km de Lomé. Il est dans ce domaine il y a 01an. Son premier crédit qu’il sollicite l’aidera à s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Il veut acheter un terrain pour construire un logement, augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et fonder une famille solide afin de subvenir à leurs besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Augustin is unmarried, 23 years old, and he struggles constantly to guarantee a future for himself and his future children. He is a retailer of ointments, soaps, and other personal care products. His supplies are generally gotten in Lomé, and he resells them in SOKODE, a city located about 380 km from Lomé. He has been in this business for a year. 

The first loan he is requesting will help him to stock up on merchandise to respond further to the needs of his customers. He wants to buy a plot of land to build housing, increase his sales, and establish a strong family, so as to support them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr: Jean Pierre est un homme de 34 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants de 13 et 16 ans, tous deux vont à l'école. Il a ouvert un bar-alimentation qu'il gère depuis 5 ans.Grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et son accueil chaleureux et son rapport avec son voisinage,il a pu acquérir une très grande clientèle. L'augmentation croissante de sa clientèle rend son offre inférieure à la demande d'ou l'importance de ce crédit dans son activité.Grâce à lui il pourra acheter des casiers de boisson et les produits de premières nécessités en grande ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle, d'augmenter ses ventes ainsi sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: Jean Pierre is a 34 year old man. He is married with two children of 13 and 16 who both go to school. He opened a grocery-bar which he has been running for five years. Thanks to his experience in this field, to his warm reception of customers and his attitude towards his neighbours, he has managed to acquire a very large clientele. The constant expansion of his clientele means that he is unable to meet the demand, hence the importance of this credit to his activity. With the loan, he would be able to buy large quantities of crates of drinks and products of basic necessity which would enable him to satisfy his customers, increase his sales and thus his profits. He would invest part of these profits in his business and the remainder will enable him to meet his needs.

loans.use: To buy crates of drinks and products of basic necessity

loans.name: Winifrida

texts.en: Winifrida is the mother of two children, aged 4 and 7, both attending school. She is married to a policeman. Winifrida has been selling fruits for five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more fruits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Vahasi Group

texts.fr:
Asani fait partie du groupe Vahasi et  habite à Ruyigi. Elle a 25 ans et est mariée à Xavier, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de  3 à 12 ans, dont  2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sel, …) depuis 10ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d'articles à revendre dans sa boutique, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Asani, age 25, is a member of the group Vahasi and she lives in Ruyigi. She is married to a driver named Xavier. They have three children aged 3 to 12, and two of them go to school.

Asani has been in the retail business for 10 years selling rice, beans, salt, etc. from her store. 

This is her seventh loan cycle with Turame. She will use this credit to bolster her working capital and stock up on merchandise for her store. This will help to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital and stock up on merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ouindinmanegde Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTA  est la représentante du groupe OUINDINMANEGDE. Binta se porte bien. Elle est mariée  et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 02ans03mois (soit 27mois).02  vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des  plats en plastique (gobelets, sceaux, plats, bouillards etc.) et ballets depuis  03ans. Binta a acheté ses objets en plastique. Elle est très contente de Micro START ET SES Partenaires et prie que DIEU les bénisse. Mme a renouvelé son crédit et espère que tout va bien se passer. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de sankariyaaré en ville .Ses clients sont  les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02 douzaines de plats, 03 douzaines de  gobelets, 02 douzaines de sceaux et des ballets.

 Elle épargne  ses bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce  et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en:
Binta is the representative of the Ouindinmanegde group, and is doing well. She is married, and is mother to three children. The oldest of her children is 10, and the youngest is 2 years and 3 months (27 months) old. Two of her children go to school, and she has three people under her care.

Binta has sold plastic kitchenware (cups, buckets, plates, kettles, etc.) and brooms for three years. She has bought her plastic items, and is very happy with Micro Start and its partners and prays that God blesses them. She has renewed her loan, and hopes that all will go well. She gets her supplies at a market in Sankariyaré, and her customers are male and female.

Binta wants to buy two dozen plates, three dozen cups, two dozen buckets and brooms.

She saves her profits to expand her business, as well as to improve her family’s living conditions. She plans to open a large store.

loans.use: To buy two dozen plates, three dozen cups, two dozen buckets and brooms.

loans.name: Jules Magloire

texts.fr: Magloire est un homme âgé de 37 ans, fiancé et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 mois et 5 ans l'un va déjà à l'école. Il a aussi une autre personne à sa charge. Il a ouvert une alimentation pres de son domicile dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gere depuis 3 ans deja. Son petit commerce fonctionne grace à son acceuiel chaleureux, son experience dans ce domaine et la clientele qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Il solicite ce credit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minerale,cartons de sucres, des friandise,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Magloire is 37 years old and engaged to be married. He has two children, one who is 4 months old and another who is 5 years old and in school already. Magloire also has another person to support. 

He opened a grocery store near his home in a district in the capital. He has been running the store for three years already. His small business works, thanks to his warm welcomes, long experience in this domain, and the customers he has acquired over time. His customer base is becoming significant, so he no longer manages to meet the demand because his capital funds are meager. This compels him to make his purchases retail. 

He is requesting this loan to bolster his business capital in order to diversify his merchandise (rice, salt, mineral water, boxes of sugar, candies,…) and to increase his profit margin. 

He will reinvest part of his profits in his business to cover his business needs. The other part will enable him to meet his day-to-day needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, salt and boxes of soap, oil, and canned foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy logs for firewood.

loans.name: Badieye

texts.fr: Monsieur BADIEYE est un  célibataire qui habite au SENEGAL. Il  est enseignant depuis plus de 3 ans et évolue dans le secteur de l’éducation. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il vit. Il sollicite un prêt de 275000FCFA. Une partie du financement sera  prévu pour l’acquisition  de mobiliers (armoire, coiffeuse) dans l’objectif d’ une meilleure amélioration de son cadre de vie. L’autre partie du financement servira  à régler ses factures d’électricité et d’eau.
texts.en: Mr. Badieye is a bachelor who lives in Senegal. He has been a teacher for over three years and is active in the education sector. He is a member of one of the U-IMCEC offices in his locality of residence. He requests a loan of 275000FCFA. Part of the funds are intended for the purchase of furniture (wardrobe, dressing table) the objective being to improve his quality of life. The other part will enable him to pay his water and electricity bills.

loans.use: purchase a wardrobe and a dressing table for personal use.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a retail shop, a business that he has been operating for one year. He started the business through his personal savings. He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is price fluctuations and inflation.

Moses is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase it. His future plan is to expand and open a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy wholesale sugar.

loans.name: Guadalupe Maradiaga

texts.es: Guadalupe de 43 años de edad, soltera con dos hijos de 2 y seis años de edad, su actividad económica es la elaboración de piñatas, tiempo de tener el negocio 18 años, negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de la localidad, el negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un ingreso para tener un medio de vida digno, su sueños es llegar a formar a sus dos pequeños hijos para que sean personas de bien en lo social y en intelectual. El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar material para la elaboración de piñatas como: tinajas, papelillo, pega, escarcha, lentejuelas, papel crepe, cartón, entre otros.
texts.en: Guadalupe, 43 years old, is single with two children of 2 and 6 years of age. As her work she makes piñatas, having had the business for eighteen years. Her business is located in the locality's market. It developed due to the need to have an income in order to have a decent means of living. Her dream is to raise her two young children to be good people socially and intellectually. She needs the funding to buy material with which to make the piñatas like: earthenware jars, paper, glue, glitter, sequins, crepe paper, and cardboard, among other items.

loans.use: to buy earthenware jars, paper, glue, glitter, sequins, crepe paper, and cardboard, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 47-years old and is happily married to Mr. Rolando. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with four children. Rebecca is a hog-raiser in the village where they are living. She has been in her business for seven years and earns about PHP 2,500 per hog. Right now, Rebecca is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Harini

texts.en: Harini, a housewife, has two children who are still attending school. Her husband, I. Ketut, works at the port. To support the family income, Harini is selling fish in the market. Every day she buys the fish from fishermen and resells. To sell the fish, Harini rents a place in the market. Harini wants to borrow from MUK with a loan of 5M IDR to buy a place/store in the market in order not to hire anymore. Having her own place of business can save the cost of rent. The new locations are more expensive and strategic, so Harini can sell more fish. Harini hopes that with the selection of the strategic location, her sales can increase and will help welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy a place/store in the market.

loans.name: Marie Danielle

texts.fr: Marie est une femme mariée de 37 ans, mère de  trois enfants dont l'âge varie entre 4 et 16 ans,tous 3 vont déjà à l'école. en plus de cela, elle a une autre personne à sa charge. Elle est comerçante depuis 1 ans ou elle vend les frites de plantain.  C'est grace à cette activté qu'elle aide son époux à résoudre certains problèmes quotidiens. la bonne qualité de ses frites lui a permis d'agrandir sa clientèle mais l'absence de des moyens donc son petit capital de faire beaucoup des frite, alors ça ne rapporte beaucoup. c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour s'acheter ses produits en gros(régimes de plantain, bidons d'huiles et emballages) ceci augmentera considérablement le stock de ses marchandises, se ventyes et donc son bénéfice. eelle économisera une partie de ses bénéfices qu'elle réinvestira dans son activté et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoin de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie is a married woman of 37 with three children whose ages vary between four and 16 years old. All three go to school, in addition she has one other dependent person. She has been a shopkeeper for one year, she sells fried plantain. Thanks to this activity she is able to help her husband to resolve certain daily problems. The good quality of her fritters has enabled her to increase her clientele, but due to lack of means she is not able to make a large quantity of merchandise which limits her income. That is why she requests this loan to buy her products wholesale (branches of plantain, cans of oil and wrapping) this would considerably increase her stock of merchandise, her sales and thus her profits. She will save part of her profits for re investment in her business and the remainder will serve to help with the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase  branches of plantain , cans of oil and wrapping.

loans.name: Vicenta Teodora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es jubilado.

Ella junto al esposo tienen una casa con departamentos los cuales salen alquilan, pero ella también para ganar algo por su cuenta tiene un pequeño negocio, vende ropa, sabanas, productos de Avon, Esika y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días, realiza  recorridos por la ciudad y también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas y hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 8  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Esta desde el  tercer ciclo que se formo este Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Sirena meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of La Sirena in the city of Manta.  It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year, and for being a city of singular beauty with many tourist attractions.  Here lives Vicenta, 56, who is married and has three adult, independent children.  Her husband is retired.

She and her husband have a house with apartments that they rent.  She also earns an income with her small business of selling clothes, sheets, Avon, Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  Every day she goes out into the city to work, and she also sells from home where she has display cases and receives her best-known customers.  She delivers her products on credit and collects payment every eight days.  For over eight years she has been in business and it is going well.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear.  She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles and is its acting president.  She likes receiving help through the loans.

Her goal is to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 21 y  10  años de edad, el menor de ellos estudia en escuela. El marido es chofer, tiene un transporte escolar y además es comerciante. 

Ella como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que el esposo lo utilice para su negocio,  él además de dedicarse a realizar transportes también se dedica a la venta de quesos, él tres veces por semana se desplaza hasta Chone o Tosagua ciudades en las cuales compra los quesos y luego los lleva a distribuir  a comerciantes minoristas en el mercado local,  lleva más de diez años dedicado al comercio y  le va muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar quesos y repuestos que necesita su marido para el transporte. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque el grupo es muy ordenado y cumplido.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro mas nuevo.
texts.en:
Here we meet Ana, 39, who has a common-law husband and two children, ages 21 and 10.  The youngest goes to school.  Her husband is a school transportation driver and also a merchant.

Being the good wife that she is, she is taking out a loan for her husband's business.  Besides being in transportation he also sells cheese.  Three times a week he goes to Chone or Tosagua, which are the cities where he buys cheese that he later distributes to retail merchants in the local market.  For over ten years he has been in business and it is going well.

This new loan will be used to buy cheese and spare parts for her husband's businesses.  She has been in the communal bank since it began and is its acting treasurer.  She likes the group because it is very organized and responsible.

Her goal is to buy a newer car.

loans.use: To buy cheese and spare parts.

loans.name: Orfilia Esperanza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Orfilia, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad que están comprometidos y  aun viven en su casa pero de forma independiente. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.

Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de esta ciudad hace varios años, con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y ayudar a sobrellevar la carga familiar hace mas de 30 años puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, aunque lo que más elabora son prendas que luego las entrega a los pescadores para que estos las utilicen en sus viajes, también elabora pijamas y conjuntos de dormir de niños los mismos que entrega en ciertos lugares de la ciudad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en todo este tiempo.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Sirena meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of La Sirena in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year, and for being a city of singular beauty with many tourist attractions. Here lives Orfilia, 59, who is married and has three adult children who are engaged but still live independently at home.  Her husband works occasionally.

Several years ago she learned sewing at an academy in the city in order to earn her own income and hlep out with family expenses.  Over 30 years ago she set up a sewing shop in her house where she works making all kinds of clothing on an order basis for private customers.  What she makes most are clothing items she sells to fishermen who use them as travel clothes, and she also makes pyjamas and children's sleepwear which she delivers to different parts of the city.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and sometimes even later when she has a lot of orders.

This new loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing supplies.  She has been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of the help she has received all this time.

Her goal is to expand her sewing shop, and for her and her family to have good health.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.en:
Marie Therese is 31 years old and is married. She has two children, 5 and 9 years old. Marie Therese purchases long-handled wooden spoons, sieves, and charcoal stoves for her business. She has been in this business for five years, and she works from 6 a.m until 7 p.m every day. Marie Therese currently employs two people to help her in the business. 

Marie Therese has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more long-handled wooden spoons, sieves, and charcoal stoves for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future. She will be able to buy her own house and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more  long-handled wooden spoons, sieves, and charcoal stoves for resale.

loans.name: Dignabana Feminin Group

texts.fr: Groupe de solidarité, l’Association DIGNABANA est localisée dans la région centrale du Togo et a pour  secrétaire Branouwé. Elle est revendeuse et cultivatrice de profession et est mariée à un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 06 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Le premier est âgé de 25 ans et le dernier de 10 ans. Branouwé est âgée de 49 ans. Son activité est basée en RÉGION CENTRALE. Elle est dans ce domaine depuis 2002 et se fait aider par 02 personnes. Elle souhaite avec ses revenus assurer le bien être et une meilleure scolarisation à ses enfants. Pour l’avenir, elle espère augmenter sa superficie cultivable et assurer le bien être social à toute sa famille. Les autres membres du groupe exercent comme activité la culture du maïs et espèrent aussi augmenter leurs superficies cultivables. Ce prêt qu’elles sollicitent leur servira à s'approvisionner en outils de travail(engrais).
texts.en:
The DIGNABANA loan group is located in the central region of Togo and their secretary is Branouwé.  Branouwé is a reseller and farmer by profession and her husband is also a farmer.  They have six children, three of whom attend school.  Their eldest is 25 years old and their youngest is 10.  Branouwé is 49 years old. 

Her business is located in the central region of Togo.  Branouwé has been in this business since 2002 and has the assistance of two other people.

She hopes to use her income to ensure the well-being of her children and offer them better schooling.  In the future, she hopes to increase the area of land over which she grows her crops and ensure the social well-being of her whole family.  The other members of this group also grow corn and also hope to increase the area of land on which they grow their crops. 

The loan they are requesting will allow them to stock up on working tools.

loans.use: to buy working tools

loans.name: Bella Alegría

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Bella, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de la ciudad.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella junto al esposo con sus ahorros también compraron un taxi del cual le quedan buenos ingresos, ellos le pagan a una persona para que lo conduzca.  Llevan más de 8 años dedicados  a esta actividad y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y  repuesto para el taxi. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es comprar otro taxi.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Sirena meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of La Sirena in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year, and for being a city of singular beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Here we meet Bella, 55, who is married and has two adult, independent children.  Her husband works for a company in the city.

She is a homemaker who, in order to earn her own living to help her husband with household expenses, sells clothes by catalogue and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works three days a week, two to three hours a day, and delivers her products on credit, collecting payment every eight days.  She and her husband also bought a taxi with their savings and it gives them a good income.  They pay someone to drive it and have been in business for eight years, and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and spare parts for her taxi.  This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the easy payment terms.

Her goal is to buy another taxi.

loans.use: To buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Novalyn

texts.en:
Novalyn is from the village of Sillawit. She is 31 years of age and is married. Novalyn's business is a sari-sari store. She has been in her business for three years. She usually receives an income in the amount of PHP 300 a day. Novalyn works hard to improve their family living. 

To make it possible, Novalyn is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, bread, curls, candies, and condiments to sell. She hopes that her business will grow further to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, bread, curls, candies, and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Valeria Cecibel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Valeria, tiene 23 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Ella estudia Marketing en una Universidad de Manta y también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas y productos de Cyzone (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en el centro donde ella estudia ya que allá tiene varios clientes que siempre le compran porque les da muy buenas facilidades de pago. Lleva más de 3 años con su negocio el cual comenzó con el primer crédito  que recibió del banco.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas, cremas, perfumes entre otros productos que ella vende. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con esto empezó su negocio el cual le da  ganancias para solventar los gastos que generan sus estudios.
 
Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Sirena meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of La Sirena in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year, and for being a city of singular beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Here lives Valeria, 23, who is single and lives with her parents.  She studies Marketing at the University of Manta and works selling all kinds of clothing, sport shoes and Cyzone products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She sells door to door, although most of her sales are made where she studies since she has a lot of customesr there who buy from her for the easy payment terms.  For over three years she has been in business and started it with her first loan through the communal bank.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, sport shoes, creams, perfumes and other products she sells.  She has been in the communal bank for three years and enjoys it because it helped her start the business that covers her educations costs.

When she finishes her education she wants to become a great business owner.

loans.use: To buy clothing, sport shoes, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Yakenia

texts.es:
Claudia Yakenia vive en el municipio de El Sauce, ubicado al occidente del departamento de León, es una joven de 35 años, casada, con 3 hijos a su cargo, todos menores de edad. Gracias a su profesión como profesora que ha desempeñado durante siete años está construyendo poco a poco su propia vivienda para darles a sus pequeños buenas condiciones de vida y un desarrollo social agradable.
 
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar medicina y pagar consultas médicas con el fin de mejorar la salud de su esposo el cual fue operado de emergencia y la salud de su mamá quien también se encuentra un poquito mal de salud. Con esto adquirirá medicina en general y les realizará unos exámenes para tratar las enfermedades con más certeza y su recuperación sea más exitosa.

Se siente muy agradecida y satisfecha por el apoyo que le ha brindado KIVA y Ceprodel, ya que con estos créditos ha logrado invertir en la construcción de su pequeña casita y ha resuelto problemas de índole de salud que son de gran importancia para ella.
texts.en:
Claudia Yakenia lives in the municipality of El Sauce, which is located in the western area of León.  She is 35 years old, she is married, and she has three children that she cares for, all of whom are minors.  Thanks to her job as a teacher that she has had for seven years, she is slowly building her own home so that she can provide her children with better living conditions and a pleasant social atmosphere.

She is seeking this credit so that she can buy medicine and pay for medical consultations, with the goal of improving the health of her husband who had an emergency operation and improving her mother's health, who also has health problems.  With this loan she will buy medicines in general and also be able to pay for doctor's exams, so they can treat the sicknesses with certainty and improve the success of their recoveries.

She is very thankful and pleased by the support that KIVA and Ceprodel have given her.  With these loans she has succeeded in investing in the construction of her small home and now she can resolve these health problems which are very important to her.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to pay for medical consultations.

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre desde hace 12 años pero aun no ha tenido hijos. El marido traba en una empresa en esta linda ciudad.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de la marca Nivi y productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en los ratos que ella está desocupada, no tiene horario fijo,  ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días dependiendo de cómo deseen sus clientes. Lleva dos años dedicada  a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho.
 
Su sueño es tener un bebé.
texts.en:
The La Sirena Community Bank gets together every 15 days in the La Sirena neighborhood in the city of Manta.  Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that attract a lot of tourists throughout the year, and for being a beautiful city unrivaled for its many tourist attractions.

Rosa lives here, she is 32 years old, and she has been married for 12 years but she still hasn't had children.  Her husband works in a company in this lovely city.

She is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, she sells Nivi clothing and Esika products (beauty projects, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women.)  She sells door-to-door when she has free time.  She does not have a fixed schedule.  She accepts credit and allows her customers to repay her every eight or fifteen days.  She has done this work for two years and it has gone very well.

This loan is so that she can buy clothing, perfumes, lotions, and cosmetics.  This is her fifteenth loan with the Community Bank and she likes working with them because the money arrives quickly and they give her a lot of help.

Her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, lotions, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Petita Angela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Petita, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 11 y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante de pescado.

Ella con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar con los gastos de estudios de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  trabaja todos los días unas dos horas diarias,  deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, lleva más de 4 años  en esta actividad y le va muy bien. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace seis ciclos  y le gusta por los beneficios y otros créditos que ofrece la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The La Sirena Group gets together every 15 days in the La Sirena neighborhood in the city of Manta.  Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that attract a lot of tourists throughout the year, and for being a beautiful city unrivaled for its many tourist attractions.

Petita lives here.  She is 33 years old, she is married, and she has three children that are 5, 11, and 8 years old.  The two older children study in secondary school and the younger one in primary school.  Her husband is a fish salesman.

In order to earn her own income and to help pay the education expenses of her children, she sells Avon and Lebel products (beauty products such as cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women.)  She sells door-to-door and she works every day for about two hours per day.  She sells her products on credit and charges her customers weekly or bi-weekly, depending on what they prefer.  She has done this work for more than four years and it has gone very well.  Most of her sales are from the cosmetics and perfumes.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, accessories, cosmetics, and lotions.  She has belonged to the Community Bank for the past six loan cycles and she likes the benefits and other loans that the bank has offered to her.

Her dream is to have her own home because her current home is leased.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, accessories, cosmetics, and lotions.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is 21 years old and is married to a farmer in the village where they are living. Maureen is engaged in the transportation business, using their motorcycle. She has been in this business for almost two years and earns about PHP 300 a day. Right now, Maureen is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jenus

texts.en: Jenus, 21 years old, is a married entrepreneur living in Poblacion 3, Clarin with his child.  He earns a living from his transport service business. He has had this business for almost 2 years, and he earns PHP 6,000 a month. To improve the business, Jenus is borrowing PHP 15,000 from GDMPC.  He joined the group in 2010 to obtain a loan for accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful he may have the opportunity to expand his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
For more than five years in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Maricel, a 29-year-old married woman, has made a living through operating a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns PHP 8,000 a month for these activities.

Recently, Maricel joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase new items such as candy, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, soap,  etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candy, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Gissela Cesibel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Gissela, tiene 23  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de tres años y el menor de 4 meses de nacido. El marido trabaja en una empresa constructora.
 
Ella con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto poder solventar sus gastos y ayudar en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, trabaja de tres a cuatros  días a la semana en sus recorridos ya que su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha  las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos ya que su mamá se hace cargo de sus hijos que son muy pequeños, lleva seis meses en este negocio el cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y le va muy bien ya que cada día tiene más clientes. Lo que más vende es la ropa de damas.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños ya que tiene varios pedidos para este mes. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta porque con el crédito empezó su negocio con el cual se siente independiente.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Sirena meets every 15 days in the La Sirena suburb of the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are frequently visited at all times of the year and also for being a city of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions. Here lives Gisella who is 23 years old and has a defacto relationship from which she has had two children of three years and the younger of four months. Her husband works in a construction business. 

With the aim of being able to rely on her own income to pay for her own expenses and help out the household she sells clothes by catalogue-order. She works three to four days of each week. She takes advantage of the mornings to make her sales trips, as she finds it easiest  since her mum can then look after her small children. She has been working in this business for six months and she started it with the first loan she recieved from the bank. It is going very well for her and every day she has more customers. What she sells most is womens' clothing. 

She is going to use this loan to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shits and children's clothing since she has a number of orders for this month. She has been with the communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because with the loan she started her business which allows her to feel  independent. 

Her dream is to have her own house since the one she is living in is rented.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shits and children's clothing.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa Josefina, con quien tiene seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos: Yelvi y Nayely; la casa donde viven la heredó de sus padres hace 35 años.
Desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron el bordado y ahora él se lo enseña a sus hijos. Ya tiene 16 años dedicándose a esta actividad. Todo el día se dedica al bordado de vestuarios típicos, faldas y mantas. Su trabajo es tan bueno que personas de otras ciudades visitan su casa para encargarle el bordado de los trajes que utilizarán para las festividades. Con el tiempo, Rolando diseñó sus propios vestuarios y los alquila a bailarines de su localidad; “de esa manera se gana más”, comenta. Ahora él se encuentra preparando todo para la temporada que se acerca, donde tendrá más pedidos para bordar. 

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Santiago de Chauca” y este es su crédito número 18 con MFP. En todo este tiempo logró obtener grandes beneficios, mejorando su negocio y aprendiendo de los integrantes de su grupo, a quienes quiere como hermanos. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Rolando invertirá este dinero en la compra de hilos por conos y telas de colores para sus bordados, pues en esta temporada aumenta la demanda.
texts.en:
Rolando is 55 years old. He lives with his wife Josefina, with whom he has six children. He lives with only two of them now, Yelvi and Nayely. The house where they live was inherited from his parents 35 year ago.

Since he was little, his parents taught him how to embroider and now he teaches his own children. He has worked in this activity for 16 years. All day he embroiders traditional clothing, skirts and blankets. vidad. His work is so good that people from other cities visit his house to order embroidery from him for the clothing they will use for festivals. Over time, Rolando has designed his own clothing and he rents them to local dancers. “This way, I earn more", he remarks. Now he is preparing everything for the approaching season, when he will have more orders to embroider. 

He belongs to the “Santiago de Chauca” communal bank and this is his 18th loan with MFP. This whole time he has gained great benefits, improving his business and learning from the members of his group, whom he loves like siblings. For this reason, he promises to make his payments on time.

Rolando will invest this money in buying cones of thread and colred fabrics for his embroidery, because this is when demand increases.

loans.use: to buy cones of thread and colored fabrics for his embroidery

loans.name: Jumrah

texts.en: Jumrah lives in the village of Pejarakan in Singaraja, North Bali. He worked as a clerk in a hotel. He borrowed a loan from MUK to enlarge his shop at home, which will be managed by his wife. Currently, Jumrah has stalls for selling everything a family needs, such as cooking oil, rice, herbs and more. He will use the loan to enlarge the shop and buy other merchandise such as shampoo, soap, school stationery and fuel oil. Jumrah hopes this effort will be more successful so he can save for the future of his family.

loans.use: To enlarge the shop and buy other merchandise such as shampoo, soap, school stationery and fuel oil.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is married and a mother of three children. She is 55 years old and lives in Mangga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Luz makes and sells bags to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. She earns 5,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Luz has requested a loan of 8,600 PHP from GDMPC to purchase materials for making bags. Luz is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making bags.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth, age 25, buys and sells a variety of vegetables. She is married to Almario, a responsible father and a farmer in their village. 

Bernadeth would like to buy more vegetables for sale. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy string beans, squash, eggplant and potatoes to sell in the village. Bernadeth would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to buy string beans, squash, eggplant and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, age 58, is married and lives in Mantik, Tangub City. Felisa operates a sari-sari (convenience) store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and she earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

Felisa is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Felisa hopes that her business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store.

loans.name: Chevee Ann

texts.en:
Chevee Ann, age 22, is single and resides in Sta. Maria, Tangub City. Chevee Ann owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Chevee Ann has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Chevee Ann joined GDMPC. In the future, Chevee Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee for her general store.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en: Shirly is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old and single. She runs a general store to earn a living. She has been running her business for two years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. In 2011 she joined GDMPC. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products for her store such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. Shirly hopes to make her business bigger to triple the return of her earnings for her future.

loans.use: to purchase products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Jeanly

texts.en: Jeanly is a 46-year-old mother of three school-aged children. For the past six years, she and her husband have operated a motorcycle transportation business. They work hard every day just to meet the needs of their children. Jeanly is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy paint, wheels, and gas for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy paint, wheels, and gas for her motorcycle

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is from Silanga, Tangub City. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Eliza is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Eliza has been in this business for three years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. Eliza is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2011, Eliza joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 42 years old, a farmer who is very eager to provide a good living to his family. He tries to lift up his family from poor living and to experience a comfortable life. With this objective, he doubles his hard work in his farming business to gain better crops. He has been experienced in this field for 15 years and he knows that it is not an easy occupation. But despite that, his desire to achieve his dream inspires him to develop his business. 

For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000 to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to develop his farm more. He hopes through these inputs he can grow plenty of crops for the betterment of their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Josefine

texts.en:
Josefine is 59 years old and is married. She works hard to earn a living. 

Josefine owns a variety store, and she has had this business for many years. She is aiming to increase her product offering to satisfy her customers' demands, but her income is inadequate. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos to buy grocery items such as canned goods, daily use products, bread and candy to sell. She believes that her sacrifices will lead her to reach her goal, which is to increase her profit and save money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, daily use products, bread and candy to sell.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 52 years old and an industrious father of three children. He is very enthusiastic to support his family through his farming business. With this kind of occupation, he is able to provide for his family's basic necessities, but he is aiming for a higher way of living. 

This led him to request a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. He hopes to make his business more productive with his loan and to earn sufficient income for the improvement of his family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan (in the photo) is 33 years old and her husband, Phan, is also 33 years old. They have been married since 1998 and have two daughters - one is a garment worker and the other one is still young. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Nan is a garment worker and her husband is a farmer. Nan is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: Madame KHARY est une femme divorcée qui vit au SENEGAL. Elle est  commerçante et s’active  depuis plus de 10 ans dans la vente de tissus, sacs et chaussures divers. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs au sein de la dite institution. Les revenus que lui procure son activité   lui permettent  de subvenir aux besoins de ses 2  enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle sollicite un prêt de  200000FCFA dans le but d’acquérir un local pour exercer son activité de commerce. Avec son financement,  elle envisage l’achat de tissus, chaussures et sacs a main qui seront destinés a la vente, ceci dans le but de renforcer le stock de ses marchandises et ainsi  accroitre les bénéfices réalisés pour mieux faire  face a ses responsabilités de mère de famille.
texts.en:
KHARY is a divorced woman who lives in Senegal. She has been selling fabric, bags, and shoes for over ten years now. She is a member of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC, and she has already paid back two previous loans to said institution. The revenue that she earns from her business allows her to meet the needs of her two children who are living in her care.

She is seeking a 200,000 FCFA loan with the hopes of being able to buy a shop in which she could conduct her business.

With her loan, she plans to buy fabric, shoes, and handbags that she will resell. She is striving to build-up her stock of merchandise and thus increase her profit in order to better fulfill her responsabilities as mother of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes, and bags intended for resale

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia has raised hogs for more than twenty years. She is married and has four children. Her eldest is married and the other three are still single and help her in raising her hogs and running the family's 8,000 sq. meters of rice field. Dionisia is really grateful to her family because they cooperate in their household activities, while she and her husband are busy generating income. 

Dionisia has four hogs fattening. She plans to purchase hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines to improve the growth of her pigs. But due to insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She hopes to use this loan to provide her pigs with proper nutrition. In this way, she can get a better price for her pigs, which will enable her to improve her family's standard of living and to pay her other obligations to other people. This would really help her a lot, most especially in making her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is engaged in the transportation business. She has been in this business for three years. Marissa is married to Reynaldo, a father, who helps her to manage their motorcycle. 

At this moment, Marissa is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy paint and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes that she continuously gains income through her transport motorcycle business.

loans.use: to buy paint and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 57 years old and has two grown children. She and her family live in Talibon, Bohol. 

Felicidad relies on her rice farming business and raising chicken for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and feed for her chickens. The fertilizer will keep her crops resistant to pests and the feed will help her chickens to grow healthy and to be easier to market. 

Felicidad knows that with her small business, she can make improvements and plans with the help of the loan. Her profit will then be used for family consumption, house renovation and savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 54 años, está casada con Walter desde hace 28 años, tienen dos hijos: Mabel y José.
Ella es la tesorera de su banco comunal, pues siempre le gusto administrar el dinero. Gracias a ello ahora tiene una ferretería, bien equipada y surtida. Según cuenta, le va muy bien en su negocio, pues abre sus puertas todos los días, sin descanso. Pero como es una mujer trabajadora, también vende comida los domingos en un espacio de su casa. Por su parte, su esposo se dedica al alquiler de maquinarias pesadas a instituciones del estado y constructoras privadas, por las que reciben un pago mensual, con ello paga los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Ahora quiere surtir su ferretería con todo el material posible, “existen días en los que llegan compradores grandes que se llevan cemento y demás materiales por cantidad y no me abastezco”, afirma.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este su crédito número 27 con MFP. En todos estos años pudo mejorar su negocio, pues aprovechó el dinero con mucha inteligencia.
