Por otro lado, promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Y además le agrada ser parte de su grupo, donde los integrantes son solidarios, “somos como una familia”, afirma.
Yolanda invertirá este dinero en la compra de arena, cemento y demás mercadería para surtir su ferretería.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old. She has been married to Walter for 28 years. They have two children, Mabel and José.
She is the treasurer of her communal bank, because she always liked managing money. Because of this she now has a hardware store, which is well equioed and stocked. According to her, she opens her doors every day, without rest. But since she is a hardworking woman, she also sells food on Sundays from a space in her house. On his part, her husband rents out heavy machinery to state institutions and private construction firms. He receives monthly payments for this and from that pays for their children's university educations. Now she wants to stock her hardware store with all possible materials. "There are days when big buyers arrive and take cement and other materials in large quantities and I don't have enough stock." she affirms.  

She belongs to the “IDME” communal bank and this is her 27th loan with MFP. Every year she has been able to improve her business, because she took advantage of the money in a very intelligent way. On the other hand, she promises, once again, to make her payments. She also likes being a part of the group, where the members are supportive. "We are a family", she affirms.

Yolanda will invest this money in buying sand, cement and other merchandise to stock her hardware store.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and other merchandise to stock her hardware store.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie has been engaged in the hog raising business for two years. She is happily married to Diobelyn and they have been blessed with five children. Only her youngest child goes to school because three of her children have been settled for early marriage. The fifth child is her helper in raising her hogs because her husband is busy in their other business.

Raising hogs has been quite hard because it can cause some diseases but Rosie is determined to raised them well. So, at her very best, she wakes up early in the morning to feed them and clean their pig pen. Rosie believes that her sacrifices will yield a fruitful outcome wherein she can generate a better income to sustain her family's basic needs.

Rosie would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8000 to purchase livestock feed and vaccines for her pigs. She is hoping that this loan will be granted so that she can send her youngest child to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and vaccine to improve the growth of her pigs

loans.name: Erdene

texts.en:
Erdene, 47, works as a specialist in oxygen machinery at the medical center.  Her husband, Galbadrakh, is a taxi driver and he also makes crafts and sells them to customers in the bazaar for extra income. 

Erdene lives with her husband; all of their children moved out of her old house, which was built many years ago. The house has a heat loss problem through its walls and some other parts. In winter, they feel very cold and use a coal-fired stove to stay warm. Before this winter, she wants to repair her house and add wall insulation to it. As she told us, it will be very beneficial to reduce her coal expenses. It will also be good for the environment to reduce coal usage. The loan she is taking will be used to buy insulation materials such as foam, cement, etc. to add wall insulation to her old house.

loans.use: To add wall insulation to her old house.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina shows patience and determination in achieving her dreams. She would like to give a better life to her family. Though Marcelina is a widowed still she keeps busy all day long managing her sari-sari store in front of her house to provide their family needs. She has been operating this business for almost seven years and she earns approximately PHP 300 each day in this business. 

Marcelina is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, and cooking oil to sell in her store. She needs to stock more commodities in her store to increase the capacity of sales from her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle, a 29-year-old mother of one child, is the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for two years. She is working hard every day just to meet the needs of her family. 

Rochelle has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
Estrella tiene 53 años, vive con sus dos hijos: Wilfredo y Yamileth, en la casa que compró hace 10 años.
Su actividad económica desde hace 20 años es la venta de carne, para ello compra los cerdos de mayor peso y en estado saludable, los mata y vende la carne en las ferias regionales. Con ello obtiene buenas ganancias, además aprovechar su puesto para vender productos de belleza. Le va bien en su negocio, “vendo más cantidad de carne en las festividades”, afirma. Hace poco adquirió y pintó el ambiente donde abrirá su chicharronería (lugar donde se vende platos a base de carne de cerdo), y espera empezar a trabajar dentro de poco, ya que la casa donde abrirá su restaurante es de su esposo y se ubica en una zona comercial, por lo que tiene muy buenas expectativas. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este su crédito número 26 con  MFP. En todos estos años pudo mejorar su negocio, pues aprovechó el dinero con mucha inteligencia. Promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Estrella invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de sillas y mesas para poner en funcionamiento su nuevo restaurante.
texts.en:
Estrella is 53 years old. She lives with her two children, Wilfredo and Yamileth, in the house she bought 10 years ago.  
Her economic activity for the last 10 years has been selling meat. To do that, she buys pigs with a good weight and in good health. She slaughters them and sells the meat in regional markets. With this she makes good income. In addition, she also uses her sales spot to sell beauty products. Her business is going well. "I sell more meat during holidays". she affirms. A little while ago, she acquired and painted a locale where she will open a  chicharronería (a place where pork dishes are sold). She hopes to start working soon, since the house where she will open the restaurant is her husband's and is located in a commercial area, so she has good expectations. 

She belongs to the “IDME” communal bank and this is her 26th loan with MFP. Every year she has been able to improve her business, because she took advantage of the money in a very intelligent way. She promises, once again, to make her payments. 

Estrella will invest the money from this loan in buying chairs and tables to get ner hew restaurant running.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to start running her new restaurant.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Batsaikhan, 38, has run a freight transportation business since 2007 nonstop. In 2010, he renovated his mini truck and he plans to continue his business normally in the future. There are four people in his family: he lives with his wife and his two children, a boy and a girl. His wife works as a teacher in the kindergarten and her salary is low. 

Since last year, Batsaikhan has been rebuilding his house and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. Due to a shortage of money, he has not been replaced the floor, window sills, or wall paper, etc. The main thing he wants to install to his house is electric heating panels to save on the cost of coal and reduce the harmful effects of coal usage. Before, his family used to use a coal-fired stove to warm their home in wintertime.
 
Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F), even in the cities.  Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  In addition, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of main reasons for Mongolian air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems, as well as to buy cars that run on natural gas.  The loan Batsaikhan is taking will be dedicated to covering the cost of electric heating panels and some missing building materials for rebuilding his family house.

loans.use: To cover the cost of electric heating panels and some missing building materials for rebuilding his family house.

loans.name: Murod

texts.en:
Murod is one of the smart members of his family who live happily but poorly. He is 48 years old and has a lovely wife who helps him with business. They are bringing up four children.  Murod and his wife try to provide them with high quality living conditions. 

With this aim, 12 years ago Murod began his own business with gardening. He has a garden full of pomegranate and quince trees. He collects pomegranate and quinces and sells to local people. The developing side of his business is connected to his harvest. This season he has got little harvest that’s why he wants to buy mineral fertilizers to make his land better and fill his business assets and continue selling his goods.  His income is small and he can’t do it. 

Murod is asking for a loan of 3000 USD for developing his business. Each month he will make his payment on time. He will happy if you support him.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en: Marziya is 18 years old and she is not married yet. She lives with her parents. Marziya decided to start a new business in animal husbandry. She studied the course ‘To get a success’  from a women's organization and learned skills about business.  Her mother will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy sheep for her new business. She will get through using the loan and her business will be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy sheep for her new business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This is Ahmad, a young Lebanese man. He’s 23 years old, single, and living with his parents and three siblings at their house located in one of the beautiful Lebanese villages. He, together with his father, is managing the family expenses. However, Ahmad decided to have his own business and take some responsibilities on his own. In 2008, he started to take home painting projects in his town and the neighboring villages. He works with high professionalism, wishing to grow in this domain. 

Today, he’s looking to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional paint and new colors to be able to start his new project. Ahmad is really ambitious. He’s seeking to launch a painting company under his name, where he can deliver paintings to all the surrounding shops and therefore increase his revenues.

loans.use: to purchase additional paint and new colors

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Huy is a rice grower as well as a local rice trader in her village in the Baray district of Kompong Province. She is 48 years old and a mother of three children – one married child and two single children who are attending school. She primarily grows rice rather than other crops, and each harvesting season, she usually buys rice from farmers at a suitable price to stock for future resale. Through these activities, she can generate income, from which she can pay for food and commodities, as well as allowances for her school-aged children. Huy has been in this occupation for almost 30 years.

Huy would like to borrow some funds from lenders to invest in purchasing a large number of cashew nuts, and then she will sell them to other traders for a profit. That is why she is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD. Through this investment, Huy hopes that she can yield a better income, which she will reinvest in her farming and rice trading business to double the return.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of cashew nuts for future resale.

loans.name: Musarat's Group

texts.en:
Musarat is a 36-year-old married woman with a large family, consisting of her husband and four children. She is a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband earns his livelihood by fitting floor tiles and has done so for the last 18 years. He is very hard working and dedicated to his job. However, his income is constrained due to the unavailability of a tile-cutting machine.

Musarat, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a tile-cutting machine for her husband. She is hopeful that the loan will bring a positive change to their monthly income and help her in providing a better life and education to her children.

loans.use: To buy a tile-cutting machine for her husband.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 40 años, está casado con Deysi y tienen una pequeña hija llamada Zoremi. La casa donde viven la compró hace 2 años.
Desde que formó su familia trabajó mucho, ahorrando el dinero que pudo para comprar su casa. Por su parte, su esposa administraba los gastos del hogar con los ingresos que percibía de su trabajo como farmacéutica. Ahora que tienen la estabilidad que buscaban y abrieron una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda. Su idea comenzó cuando adquirieron la casa en una zona muy transitada, en la carretera central, donde no hay ninguna tienda de alimentos, mirando esa oportunidad juntaron el dinero para comenzar el negocio. “Ya son dos meses que comenzamos con la tienda y nos está caminando bien, los vecinos comprar todo el día”, afirma.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Santiago de Chauca” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por eso promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
David invertirá este dinero en la compra de bebidas por cajas, sacos de arroz y azúcar para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
David is 40 years old. He is married to Deysi and they have a little daughter named Zoremi. They bought the house they live in 2 years ago.
Since he started his family he has worked hard, saving what he could to buy his house. On her part, his wife managed the household expenses with the income she received from being a pharamcist. Now that they have the stability they have saught, they have opened a store in their home. His idea started when they acquired the house in an area where a lot of people go by on the central roadway where there is no grocery store. Seeing this opportunity, they put together the money to start the business. “It's already been two months since we started the store and it is going well for us. The neighbors buy there all day long," she affirms.

He belongs to the “Santiago de Chauca” communal bank and this is his first loan with MFP. That is why he promises to make his payments on time. 
David will invest this money in buying crates of beverages, and sacks of rice and sugar for his store.

loans.use: to buy crates of beverages, sacks of rice and sugar for his store.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her husband in her small house and land plot in the ger district (a district of traditional Mongolian nomadic yurts) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They have one son and one daughter, both whom have moved out their parents' home. Oyuntsetseg works as a conductor at the bus station. Her husband, Erdenebat, runs a taxi business and has been operating his business for many years as a skillful driver.

Oyuntsetseg is taking a loan to install a bio-toilet in the backyard of her house because she thinks it will be good for the health of the environment and  the people. In the Mongolian market, bio-toilets are quite expensive and there are few suppliers. Currently, her family uses an old wooden toilet and it is very harmful to the ground and air. The 3,000,000 MNT loan she is requesting will be dedicated to covering the cost of a good quality bio-toilet for her home.

loans.use: To cover the cost of a good quality bio-toilet for her home.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 44 years old, married, and has two children, ages 18 and 21. She and her family live in San Francisco, Talibon, Bohol. Janeth's husband works as a farmer. 

Janeth provides manicure and pedicure services to her customers in her community. She also helps in farming with her husband. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm, different types of nail polish and cuticle remover. Janeth works hard to help her husband provide for their family's needs. Janeth hopes to have a stable income by acquiring more customers to patronize her service and giving her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and nail polish and cuticle remover for her manicure service.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak is 62 years of age and a single parent of four children. She lives in the Baray district with her three single children, while the oldest one has started a new family. Chak is a hard-working mother who always looks for ways to generate income for her family. All of her children have their own employment and support her financially, but Chak doesn’t want to depend on their remittances. For this reason, Chak keeps making progress in her farming and vegetable growing business.

As of now, Chak would like to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase a water pump to carry enough water to the fields. Through this investment, she believes that she can make her crops more productive and yield a better income. And with the remaining funds, she will purchase some piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to carry enough water to the fields.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson (pictured here on a motorcycle, not to be confused with the loan use) is a resident and a farmer in Nyamira South Rift Kenya where he lives with his family of three children who are aged between 12 and 5 years. He has one farmhand and sells his produce of milk, tea, eggs, maize and beans. He also sells seedlings and carries out lumbering for additional income. 

Jackson has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a dairy unit (for 20,000 KES) and buy poultry (for 20,000 KES). He says the additional income will help him improve the living standards of his family and educate his children. 

Jackson says the main challenge remains flooding of local markets with similar products from farmers.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy poultry

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 32 years old and married. She has a general store where she earns about 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a week. She wants to re-stock her sari-sari (general) store. To make it possible, Luisa is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase grocery items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, and other ingredients to sell. 

Her family is her motivational guide in improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak is a gardener, while her husband, Sok is a motor taxi driver. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have three sons and one daughter. One is a security guard and others are attending school. 

Vannak had already asked for a Kiva loan. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase one cow to raise. She will get extra income from selling the calf when the cow gives a baby.

loans.use: To purchase one cow to raise.

loans.name: Sabera

texts.en:
Sabera is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya and has been in active farming for fifteen years with milk, maize and beans for the local markets. She is married with three children aged between 19 and 10 years, all of whom go to school. 

Sabera has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero grazing unit. She says farming has been the main source of income to meet family needs and is optimistic she will grow the business and improve the quality of her dairy cows. She will use the income mostly to meet the educational needs of her children. 

Sabera says climatic changes remain a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ouleye

texts.fr: Madame OULEYE est mariée et réside au SENEGAL. Elle évolue dans le domaine du commerce plus précisément dans la vente de basins et de tissus teintés ou elle a capitalisé  une expérience de plus de cinq ans.  Elle a en charges trois enfants âgés entre  un et sept ans. Elle a déjà remboursé quatre prêts antérieurs dans le guichet de l’U-IMCEC ou elle est membre. Elle sollicite un crédit de 125000FCFA prévu pour   l’achat de marchandises a revendre  pour les besoins de son commerce. Son plus grand rêve est de développer mais aussi rentabiliser  son activité afin de parvenir a réaliser  l’acquisition d’un grand magasin pour la vente de tissus et divers autres  articles d’habillement.
texts.en:
Ms. OULEYE is married and resides in Senegal. She works in the commercial sector, selling damask and dyed fabrics to be exact. She has capitalized on over five years of experience. She has three children to support, from 1 to 7 years old. 

She has already repaid four loans at a U-IMCEC branch office where she is a member. She is requesting a loan of 125,000 francs CFA for buying merchandise to resell for her business.

Her greatest dream is to develop her business, as well as to renovate it in order to achieve the goal of acquiring a large store for selling fabrics and a variety of clothing.

loans.use: to buy cloth to resell

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbons de bois et des habits qu’elle coud elle même pour revendre à domicile, madame Akouvi est âgée de 39ans. Elle a pour époux un chauffeur et ils ont en charge 03 enfants dont 02 sur les bancs de l’école. Le premier a 15ans et le dernier 03ans. Elle fait ce travail seule depuis 02ans et est à son second crédit dans notre institution. Ce montant qu’elle sollicite lui servira de s’approvisionner en charbons de bois et des tissus lui servant à coudre des habits. Elle veut agrandir son activité et assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: A vendor selling charcoal and self-made clothes out of her home, Mrs. Akouvi is 39 years old. She is married to a driver. They have three dependent children, two of whom are still in school. The oldest is 15 years old, and the youngest three years old. She has been doing this line of work for two years and is on her second loan with our institution. The requested sum will allow her to stock up on charcoal and fabric for sewing clothes. She would like to expand her business and provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy charcoal as well as fabric for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Nyakeoga

texts.en:
Nyakeoga, the father of three children between the ages of ten and three, has been farming for three years, producing milk, vegetables, sorghum, poultry and beans for the local market. Cabbage is his main crop. He employs one farmhand on a permanent basis. The sole source of income for his family is farming, an activity that helps in the burden of educating his children.

Nyakeoga is glad for Juhudi Kilimo loan services, but notes that poultry disease outbreaks result in multiple bird deaths. He is now requesting a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him construct a dairy unit for his cows. He believes that hard work and access to loans will guarantee his success in farming.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit, buy poultry birds and feed.

loans.name: Séna

texts.fr: Mariée à un instituteur et mère de famille, madame Séna est âgée de 37ans. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle vend depuis 07ans des pagnes, des tissus, des chaussures, des sacs  dans une boutique. Ses produits sont de bonnes qualités et elle est sollicitée de part et d’autres de la ville de Lomé. Elle veut acheter des variétés de marchandises et sollicite un quatrième crédit pour acheter des pagnes, des tissus, des chaussures et sacs. Avec les profits, elle voudrait louer une autre boutique, avoir une grande activité et avoir  des  employés. Elle espère assurer l’avenir de la famille.
texts.en:
Married to a primary school teacher, Ms. Séna is 37 years old and a mother. To help her spouse with household expenses, she has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), fabrics, shoes, and bags in her shop for seven years. Her products are of good quality, and she is in demand around town in Lomé.

She wants to buy a variety of merchandise and is requesting a fourth loan for buying 'pagne' cloth, fabrics, shoes, and bags. With the profits, she would like to rent out another shop, have a large business, and employ people. She hopes to ensure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth, fabrics, shoes, jewelry, and bags

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya is from Tajikistan. It's a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature since its scenery is very beautiful. Robiya loves her country very much. 

She is a widow and has a son. To make a living, she sells bread in the market. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns little money for these activities. She thinks her activity is going well because she is very kind and she always loves what she does. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,300 Somoni (TJS) which will be used to buy more bread to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy bread for developing her business

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Mr Kokou est marié à une revendeuse. Il est âgé de 36ans et a 03 enfants dont 02 sur les bancs de l’école. Il est aussi revendeur mais il vend des meubles, des matelas et autres à domicile. Il manque de fonds pour augmenter son stock et il sollicite de WAGES un montant pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Avec les profits, il veut agrandir son activité et assurer une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr. Kokou is married to merchant. He is 36 years old and has three children, of whom two are in school. He is also a merchant and sells furniture, mattresses, and more out of his home. He lacks the funds for increasing his inventory, and he is requesting a loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. With the profits, he wants to expand his business and ensure a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy furniture and mattresses

loans.name: Rogina

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Rogina decided to engage in business to generate income and help her parents in financing her younger sisters' education. She is now 26 years old and still single. Her ambition in life is to educate her younger sisters and become financially stable before she is going to settle down. She owns and manages a variety store in their village selling different grocery items and some fruits and vegetables. 

She planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers needs, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, junk food, beverages, noodles, and canned goods for sale. She hopes that this financial assistance will help her to improve the business as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, junk food, shampoo, and beverages  for sale.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Payrav

texts.en: Payrav is married and has 2 children. He works hard to support his family. He has a successful business in Tajikistan. He has had this business for 4 years. He sells building materials such as wood, paint, cement, etc.. For some time his goods do not attract many customers and that’s why Payrav decided to widen his assortment, but he doesn't have enough money for it. His wife helps him with business. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD from IMON International to buy goods to widen his assortment in order to increase his business. In the future, Payrav hopes to provide a good education for his children. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy goods such as wood and paint to widen his assortment

loans.name: Miriam Abau

texts.en:
Miriam is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 4 and 12; all of them go to school.

Miriam runs a hotel and has been in business for 6 years. She has 2 employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase meat, rice and other items. Besides this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Miriam would like to expand her business and open a big hotel. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Miriam says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: for buying items like meat, rice, dodo, etc.

loans.name: Asunt Paul

texts.en:
Asunt is a 34-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 12; all of them go to school.

Asunt runs a hotel and has been in business for 6 years. She has 2 employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase meat, rice and other items. Besides this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Asunt would like to expand her business and open a big hotel. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Asunt says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: for buying items like meat, dodo, rice, etc.

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is 48-year-old married women who lives with her husband and four children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2007, her husband has been driving his own taxi, which is the only source of income for his family. 

However, for last two months his old taxi has not been running due to a problem with the engine. He wants to repair it and resume working. 

Shagufta, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. 

This loan will not only improve the taxi's condition but will help in improving her family income as well. 

Note: in the picture Shagufta holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To repair the engine of her husband’s taxi.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Housein is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 22 years old, married but still doesn’t have children. He is the only provider for the family.

Houssein has a barber shop. He established his business in 2010 and he now has 1 employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan to renovate the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak keeps on his business. Thanks to trade and photographing he is able to take care of his family and pay for his daughter’s education. Spartak spent his previous Kiva loan to buy a new professional camera.

Now Spartak is asking for a loan of 400,000 AMD to fill cartridge and to buy photographic paper, small gypseous [made with gypsum] statuettes, and paints for painting statuettes for his business.

loans.use: to fill cartridge, and to buy photographic paper, small gypseous statuettes, and paints for painting statuettes for his business.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is 26, married and has 2 infant-age children. He plans to earn and save more income to satisfy his family's needs and build his own house someday. To generate income, he cultivates their farm land by planting rice and vegetables for sale. He also uses his motorcycle transport to earn additional income. 

Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for additional capital of 35,000 PHP to buy gasoline, wheels and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Despite problems and difficulties in life, he has the determination to improve their status of living. For he believes that through patience and hard work, he will improve their status of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга – из Орджоникидзе. Она торгует разной одеждой – мужской, женской, детской, как летней, так зимней и демисезонной, начиная нижним бельем и заканчивая куртками. Ольга – владелица нескольких торговых павильонов, однако, земля под ними – арендована у рынка. Она торгует в Украине уже 20 лет, а до этого занималась бизнесом на Дальнем Востоке России. На данный момент наиболее популярным товаром в ассортименте Ольги являются нижнее белье, носки и женские халаты. 

Кредит суммой в 20 000 гривен Ольга надеется вложить в закупку товара осеннего ассортимента: штормовок, кофт, курток и т.п. Поскольку Ольга – человек деловой, то прибыль большей частью она вкладывает снова в бизнес, в его расширение. Торговлей она собирается заниматься в будущем столько, насколько ей хватит сил.
texts.en:
Olga is from Ordzhonikidze. She sells a wide range of clothing—men’s, women’s and children’s items; summer, winter and in-between-seasons wear; from underwear to outdoor jackets. Olga owns several sales stands, but the land plots on which they are located is being leased from the market. Olga has been selling in the Ukraine for some 20 years, and before that she used to have a business in Russia’s Far East. At present the most popular items in Olga’s assortment of goods are socks, underwear and women’s house coats.

Olga hopes to invest her loan of 20,000 in UAH into stocking up on goods for the fall season: wind jackets, cardigans, outdoor jackets etc. Since Olga is business oriented, she invests most of her revenue into further expansion of her business. She plans to continue working in retail, for as long as she is able to carry on.

loans.use: to stock up on goods for the fall season: wind jackets, cardigans, outdoor jackets etc.

loans.name: Jasem

texts.en:
Jasem is from Iraq. He is a 27-year-old youth client who is single and lives with one parent. He is the only provider for the family.

Jasem owns a car repair shop. He established his business in 2009 and now has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his community.

He is requesting $3,000 to renovate the shop and install an external ceiling. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and install an external ceiling

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Khadidiatou est une dame de 49 ans qui vend le petit déjeuner depuis plusieurs années. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a déjà eu à bénéficier d’un crédit au sein de l’IMCEC et demande un renouvellement de 75000 FCFA afin de pouvoir acheter du poisson fumé et séché car c’est une activité qu’elle allie à la vente du petit déjeuner.
Elle appui son époux dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: Ms. Khadidiatou is a 49-year-old woman who has been selling breakfasts for several years. She is a married mother. She has already benefited from a loan with the microfinance institution IMCEC and is asking for a renewal of 75,000 francs CFA to buy smoked and dried fish, since it's for selling breakfasts. She supports her spouse in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, smoked fish, and dried fish to make breakfasts

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel has operated her store for three years. According to her, she opens her store at 5:30 am and closes it at 7:00 pm. She closes her store early because she needs to look after her children. Rachel is married to an overseas worker and has been blessed with two children, both of whom go to school.

Rachel says, "Despite my situation as a temporarily single mother, I still have time to run my store, raise hogs and run a direct selling business. Time management, hard work and confidence are the characteristics needed in obtaining success in life."

Rachel's greatest dream is to have a better way of living, educate her two children and serve God. She has been doing her best to make this dream possible. With the business she manages, she is in need of additional capital of P8,000, which will be used to buy a variety of merchandise to re-stock her store. She is applying for a loan because her capital intended for her store was used for her hog raising business due to the high price of hog feed and vaccines. She hopes for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: William Loro

texts.en:
William is a 36-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 12. All of them go to school.

William runs a general store and has been in business for six years. He has one employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. He is taking a loan of  4,500 sdg to purchase beer, soda and other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years William would like to expand his business and open a depot. His  major challenges include high transportation costs. William says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like soda, beer, and water for his store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 59 años, viven con sus dos hijos: Juan y Raquel, en una casa alquilada.
Ella trabaja en varias actividades; de lunes a viernes, vende ropa de casa en casa, pues no cuenta con una tienda o lugar específico donde la puedan encontrar, pero también vende en las ferias de las ciudades aledañas. Pero para más adelante espera alquilar un espacio en la zona céntrica de la ciudad. Asimismo, los fines de semana, vende mazamorra (postre) en una feria grande de la ciudad de Huancayo. Como sabe que todo esfuerzo es recompensado, continúa trabajando sin descanso, pues desea ver a sus hijos realizados.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este su crédito número 28 con MFP. En todos estos años pudo mejorar su negocio, pues aprovechó el dinero con mucha inteligencia. Por otro lado, promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Y además le agrada ser parte de su grupo, donde los integrantes son solidarios.
María invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de ropa para esta temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
María, age 59, lives with her two children, Juan and Raquel, in a rented house.

She works at various business activities.  On Mondays through Fridays she sells clothes door to door.  She does not have a store or a specific place where she can be located.  However, she also sells at fairs in the outlying cities.  In the future she hopes to rent a space in a central area of the city.

On the week-ends she sells “mazamorra” (dessert) at a big fair in the city of Huancayo.  As she knows that all effort is rewarded, she continues working without rest.  She does this because she wishes to see her children become successful.

She belongs to the IDME communal bank.  This is her 28th loan with MFP.  In all of these years she was able to improve her business.  She very wisely took advantage of the money.  She pledges, once again, to make her payments.

She is pleased to be part of her group, where all of the members are supportive.

María will use the requested loan to buy various sacks of clothes for this winter season.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of clothes for this winter season.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Revendeur de téléphones portables, Komla âgé de 29ans est célibataire.  C’est en 2009 qu’il exerce cette activité dans une boutique  et il s’y plait bien. Il sollicite ce second crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, l’agrandir et plus tard se marier, fonder une famille.
texts.en: A telephone salesman, Komla is 29 years old and single.  He started this business in a shop  in 2009 and he really likes it.  He is requesting this second loan to build up his stock of merchandise in order to meet the demand of his customers.  He wants to reinvest in his business and to grow it, and later to marry and start a family.

loans.use: to buy mobile telephones.

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr: Monsieur MOMAR est un homme marié qui vit au SENEGAL. Il est pêcheur de profession  depuis  plus de 30 ans. Il est père de   sept enfants dont il a la charge. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC. Il sollicite un crédit de 300000FCFA. Le montant emprunté  servira à réfectionner  sa pirogue (peinture et charpente).Son ambition est de mieux rentabiliser son activité dans le secteur de la pêche de sorte a augmenter considérablement et progressivement ses revenus ce qui lui permettra d’acquérir dans le futur d’autres pirogues et matériaux de pêche.
texts.en:
Mr. MOMAR is a married man who lives in Senegal. He has been a fisherman by trade for over thirty years. He is the father of seven children who he supports. He is a member of one of the U-IMCEC branch offices. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs CFA. This amount being borrowed will be for refurbishing his boat (paint and carpentry).

His ambition is to make his business more profitable in the fishing sector, so that it increases his revenues considerably and progressively. This will enable him to acquire other boats and fishing supplies and equipment in the future.

loans.use: to refurbish his boat

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.en:
Fayzullo is married and has one child whom he has always wanted to provide with a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that three years ago he began his own taxi business. He has a Mercedes Benz. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. 

In this way, he will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income, which will allow him to offer his child and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his car, which he uses in his taxi service.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for the growth of her educational academy, which she has been running since 2010. 

She is a 43-year-old well-educated married woman with two sons and three daughters, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. This loan will help Farzana to expand her educational academy and to increase her monthly savings.  With this she will be able to fulfill the basic needs of her family and continue her contribution to the family's income.

She is hopeful that the loan will be productive and will help in the progress of her educational academy.

loans.use: To expand her educational academy.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Hazem owns a shop for repairing cars. He specializes in changing oil. He established his business in 1995 and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3000 as loan to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Chanthou, 40, is married and lives in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey District of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She earns a living through animal husbandry, raising pigs, ducks, and chickens. She supplements her family’s income by selling vegetables such as cucumbers, cabbage, and lettuce in her local area. Having been in this business for almost 20 years, Chanthou is able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day and can manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day after expenses. Her group consists of four members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund for two to three cycles. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her current business. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Chanthou will use her portion to buy more piglets and feed for her animal-raising business. She hopes to earn more income so as to fulfill her dream to have a prosperous market stall for expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Umuteramyi Group

texts.fr:
Médar fait partie du groupe Umuteramyi et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 31 ans et est marié  à Janvière, commerçante des chaussures. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgées de 3 à 5ans dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce de chaussures depuis 1 an. 

C’est son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chaussures, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter sa propre parcelle et y construire une maison. Il voudrait en outre voir ses enfants étudier, terminer les études et parvenir à avoir l’emploi.
texts.en:
Médar is part of the group Umuteramyi and lives in Bujumbura. He is 31 years old and married to Janvière, a shoe seller. Together they have two children, 3 and 5 years old, of whom one is in school. 

He has been doing commerce in shoes for a year.

This is his first loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and buy many shoes to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the next few years, he would like to buy his own plot of land and build a house on it. He would also like to see his children go to school, graduate, and achieve the goal of being employed.

loans.use: to buy many shoes to resell

loans.name: 2012 Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “2012” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, podología, venta de joyas, manufactura, venta de ropa, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Makarena, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un blue jeans, chaqueta de color negra, usa un pañuelo en su cuello de color blanco y lleva puesta una cartera de color negra, su cabello es de color negro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la manufactura específicamente en dulces y tortas, desde hace 3 meses. Se desempeña en sus labores en su casa 3 veces a la semana y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad ya que es ella quien a veces se dirige a los domicilios de sus clientes.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en supermercados y locales donde venden productos de manufacturación, a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará dulces, manjar, coco, harina, mantequilla, para sus dulces y tortas
Una de las metas de Makarena en su negocio es continuar y crecer para seguir captando clientela, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Makarena vive junto a sus padres. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es llegar a ser una gran microempresaria y crecer profesionalmente.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo y oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “2012” and is made up of 21 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, among whom are market traders, podiatrist, jewelry seller, manufacturer, clothing seller and service workers among others. All live in the city of Chillan.

Makarena is a member of the communal bank who is standing in the first row, second from left, dressed in blue jeans and a black jacket, with a white scarf around her neck, carrying a black bag over her shoulder, with black hair handing loose.

She has been producing a product, specifically sweets and cakes, for the past 3 months. She works at home 3 times a week and she organizes her work schedule according to her availability because she sometimes goes to her customers’ homes.

The merchandise and supplies she needs, she buys at supermarkets and stores where they sell ingredients at low cost since that is most economically feasible. With the loan she will buy sweets, delicacies, coconut, flour, butter.

One of Makarena’s goals is for her business to continue growing so she can continue attracting customers and thus aim for a better quality of life.

Makarena lives with her parents. Her dreams regarding work are to become a great small business woman and grow professionally. She is very happy and grateful for the support and opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza because it will enable her to invest in her business. She notes that the training workshops have been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development because she has learned to organize and better allocate her income and investments. 

Chillán is a community in south-central Chile. Its name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuche people. Chillán is also known as “The Cradle of the Nation” and “Land of Artists” because many leading figures in Chilean history were born here, such as the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy sweets, delicacies, coconut, flour and butter for her sweets and cakes.

loans.name: En Ti Confio Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “En ti Confío” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de papas, venta de repollo, venta de desayunos, feriantes, venta de ropa, artesanía, mecánico eléctrico, costura, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Elsa, secretaria del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un pantalón de color café oscuro, encima llevas puesto una chaqueta de color café claro, usa un collar de color naranjo y usa un bolso que lo usa cruzado, su cabello lo usa tomado y es de color castaño claro.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio específicamente a la venta de ropa nueva para todo tipo de personas, desde hace 15 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a viernes en su casa, y los sábados y domingos se ubica en un feria, su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en tiendas donde encuentra la ropa a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de diferentes tallas y modelos y además algunos accesorios como collares, aros, adornos en general.
Una de las metas de Elsa es instalar una boutique en el centro de la ciudad en que vive, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Elsa vive junto a sus padres y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Sus sueños son tener lo más pronto su boutique para brindarle una mejor situación económica a su familia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que existe confianza y respeto. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank called “En ti Confío” [I believe in you] comprises 18 entrepreneurs of different professions including: selling potatoes and cabbages; serving breakfast; managing a vendor stall; selling clothing; making handicrafts; electrician; dressmaking; and other services. All the members live in the city of Talca.

Elsa, the communal bank's secretary, is shown crouching in the second from right position in the photo. She is wearing dark brown pants and a brown jacket with orange collar; her purse strap crosses her jacket; and her brown hair is worn down. For 15 years, she has been selling many kinds of new clothing. She works from her house from Monday to Friday, and Saturday and Sunday she manages a vendor stall. Her schedule depends on her availability. She must buy her merchandise in Santiago from stores that offer prices low enough to make her business viable. She will use the loan to buy clothing and accessories such as necklaces, rings, and other items.

One of Elsa's goals is to open a boutique in the center of the city where she lives and generate more income to improve her circumstances. She lives with her parents and her 3-year-old son and hopes to open her boutique as soon as possible so that she can help her family financially. She is pleased and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza because it allows her to invest in her business. She has great confidence in and respect for her communal bank; through her training, she has learned accounting practices and new selling strategies.

Talca is part of the Maule region located in center of the country. It is the region's administrative, economic, and cultural center and the most important city in Chile's Central Valley. There is an interesting Chilean phrase, "Talca, París, y Londres" [Talca, Paris, London], which some say comes from  misstating an English phrase "Talca looks like London," referring to fog that often shrouds Talca during the winter as it does the English capital city.

loans.use: Comprará ropa de diferentes tallas y modelos y además algunos accesorios como collares, aros, adornos en general

loans.name: Anhelo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Anhelo” está conformado por 21 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de joyas de acero, accesorios tecnológicos, juguetes, bordados, ropa de mujer, lencería de mujer, semanera, almacén, peluquera, venta de chocolates, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Francisca, tesorera del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la última fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda  se encuentra delante de la ventana, usa su cabello largo y suelto y es de color castaño claro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la bisutería (confección artesanal de collares, pulseras hechas a mano) y venta de ropa de mujer juvenil, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la bisutería artesanal y 3 años a la venta de ropa. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a viernes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en locales y distribuidoras que se especializan en vender accesorios para la bisutería y en bodegas o persas para la ropa, a bajo costo por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará accesorios para collares, ropa juvenil para damas de diferentes tallas y modelos.
Las metas en su negocio son instalarse con una tienda, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Francisca vive junto a su madre, abuela, hermana y su hijo pequeño de 4 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son poder terminar sus estudios universitarios, y a nivel laboral continuar con el negocio para darle lo  mejor a su hijo y familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones, respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Anhelo." It's made up of 21 entrepreneurs who make a living doing business, specifically selling jewelry made of steel, technological accessories, toys, embroidery, women's clothing, women's lingerie, and chocolates, and working weekly and having a store and a hair salon, among offering other services. All of them belong to the city of Talca.

Francisca, the communal bank group's treasurer who is standing in the back row fourth from the right in the picture, is in front of the window and has long, light brown hair that's down. She's been making a living in the imitation jewelry business (making handmade necklaces and bracelets) for five years and selling young women's clothing for three years. She says that she works from Monday to Friday and her schedule is spread out according to her availability.

She buys the merchandise that she is going to need at a lower cost in the city of Santiago in shops and at wholesalers that specialize in selling imitation jewelry accessories and at clothing stores or street markets, therefore being financially convenient.

With this loan she will buy accessories for necklaces and young women's clothing of different sizes and styles.

The goal of her business is to settle into a store in order to generate greater earnings and thus opt for a better quality of life.

Francisca lives with her mother, grandmother, sister, and young 4-year-old son. Her dream at a personal level is to be able to complete her university studies, and at a working level, to continue with the business in order to provide the best for her son and family.

She is very happy and grateful for this opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza since it will allow her to invest in her business. She says that the trainings have been fundamental for her business and also for her own personal development since she's learned to organize and distribute her earnings and investments in a better way. With respect to the communal bank's group of which she's a part, she says that there's very good communication. Talca belongs to the region of Maule, located in the central area of the country. It represents the administrative, financial, and cultural center of the region being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.

There is a curious reference in Chile about Talca- the phrase, "Talca, Paris, and London." Among myths on the subject some say that it's a derivation from that originally said by an Englishman, "Talca looks like London," due to the abundant mist that frequently covers the city in the winter season, resembling the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy accessories for necklaces and young women's clothing of different sizes and styles.

loans.name: Roland

texts.fr: Roland est un homme de 46 ans marié père de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 22 ans,  trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle aussi une personne à sa charge. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une mercerie qu'il gère depuis 10 ans. son activité fonctionne bien sa clientèle s'agrandit au fil du temps d'où l'importance de ce crédit qui lui donnera l'opportunité d'agrandir son activité en augmentant le stock de ses marchandises à savoir acheter les tissus pagnes gros et les bobines de fils ainsi que le petit matériel nécessaire pour la coutures. il réinvestira une partie des bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit dans son activité le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Roland is a 46-year-old man who is the father of five children, from 5 to 22 years old, of whom three are still in school. He also has one other person to support. He is a merchant and has opened a sewing supplies store that he has been running for ten years. His business is doing well. His customer base is growing over the course of time, thus the importance of this loan, which will give him the opportunity to expand his business by increasing his stock of merchandise, namely 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in bulk and spools of thread, as well as sundry supplies for making clothing. He will reinvest part of his profits into his business. The rest will be saved for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth in bulk and spools of thread

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann has aimed to strengthen her small variety store business to earn sufficient income for her family. She is 26 years old and has one infant-age child. She is a single parent because her boyfriend abandoned her after learning she is pregnant. Despite this, she accepted her responsibility to support her child with the help of her parents. While she takes care of her baby, she finds time to manage her small variety store. She wants to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands, but due to insufficient capital she needs an additional of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, candies, breads, powder soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell. She believes that her loan will make it possible for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candies, breads, powder soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Balzain, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has five children. He is the only provider for the family.

Basem owns a shop for menswear. He established his business in 1997 and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3000 as loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his menswear shop

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad tiene 52 años, está casada con Donato, con quien tiene dos hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con uno de ellos, en la casa que compraron hace 37 años.
Sus padres se dedicaban a la artesanía y desde muy pequeña ella aprendió a trabajar con los telares, combinar los colores y las técnicas de bordado. “Mi papá ganaba concursos de artesanía, era uno de los mejores”, comenta. Cuando formó su familia se dedicaba a la agricultura, con esas ganancias compró los tres telares que ahora posee, con ellos realiza frazadas, vestuarios para los cantantes folklóricos y otras prendas. Los principales días de venta es durante la festividad en honor a los animales y los carnavales. En esas fechas los pedidos de sus clientes llegan todo el día, por lo que tiene que duplicar sus esfuerzos para obtener buenas ganancias. Ahora desea abrir una juguería en su casa para tener un ingreso extra.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santiago de Chauca” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo logró obtener grandes beneficios, mejorando su negocio y aprendiendo de los integrantes de su grupo, a quienes quiere como hermanos. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Trinidad invertirá este dinero en la compra de madejas de lana sintética, hilo de colores y varios kilos de algodón para realizar los pedidos que tiene por la temporada festiva.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 52 years old, and is married to Donato. They have two children, one of whom lives with them in the home that they purchased 37 years ago.

Trinidad's parents were artisans, and from a very young age she learned to work with looms, combine colors and weave intricate designs and borders in fabric. "My father would win craft contests; he was one of the best," she says. When Trinidad started her own family, she was working as a farmer. With her income from farming, she bought three looms that she still uses, and began weaving blankets, as well as costumes for folk singers and other events. Her biggest sale days of the year come during the time of the festival to honor the animals and carnivals. During this period of time, Trinidad is constantly taking orders from clients for woven items, and she has to double her efforts to keep up with demand. 

Presently, she wants to open up a juice bar to generate additional income. She is a member of the solidarity group, "Santiago de Chauca," and this is her third loan with MFP. Over the past years she has benefited greatly from loans, as they have helped her to improve her business and learn from her fellow group members, who are like brothers and sisters to her. She promises to continue her history of prompt loan payments. Trinidad plans to use the support from this loan to purchase skeins of synthetic wool, colored threads and several kilograms of cotton for completing client orders for the festival season.

loans.use: to purchase skeins of synthetic wool, colored threads and several kilograms of cotton to complete client orders for the festival season.

loans.name: Léocadie

texts.fr: Léocadie est une  femme de 41 ans mariée, mère d'un enfant âgé de 16 ans.  elle ouvert une parfumerie mélangée d'un petit secrétariat qu'elle gère depuis six ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans sa structure, ce qui pousse sa clientèle vers la concurrence ceci étant du à la petitesse de son capital parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Léocadie is a 41-year-old married woman who is the mother of a 16-year-old child. She opened a perfume shop/office which she has been running for six years already. She often has a problem with a lack of cosmetic products, hair extensions, and weaves in her shop. This drives her customers to the competition due to her meager capital, since she makes her purchases at the retail level. 

Her goal being to satisfy her customers and to make a bigger profit, she is requesting a loan to buy her supplies in bulk. This will enable her to reach her goals. The profits derived from this loan will help her to satisfy her needs and those of her child, as well as to save money for growing her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy boxes of hair extension, weaves, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Alecsander

texts.es:
Alecsander tiene 49 años, está casado con Blanca, con quien tiene dos hijos, quienes ya son independientes.
Junto a su esposa comparten el trabajo; ella se levanta muy temprano para atender su tienda de comestibles, mientras él recoge los litros de leche de los ganaderos de la zona. Usan l aleche para la elaboración de quesos. A la semana elaboran un promedio de 490 quesos que trasladan a los comerciantes mayoristas en la capital del país. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues gracias a eso pudo obtener su auto y unas motos que le ayudan en trasladarse a la ciudad, pues su pueblo queda a dos horas. Ahora desea incrementar su producción e industrializar el proceso, porque por el momento la elaboración es artesanal.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que promete seguir con los pagos de manera puntual. Le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo, ya que le enseñan a administrar su dinero.
Alecsander invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de varios litros de leche para abastecerse y seguir con su producción de quesos. Al día compra un promedio de 400 litros.
texts.en:
Alecsander, age 49, is married to Blanca.  They have two children, who are now independent.

He and his wife share the work.  She gets up very early in order to tend to their food store.  Meanwhile, he picks up liters of milk from the cattle farmers in the area.  They use the milk to make cheeses.  They make an average of 490 cheeses a week.  They transport the cheeses to the wholesale merchants in the capital of the country.

He likes his work a lot.  Thanks to this he was able to get his car and some motorcycles, which help in transporting the milk to the city.  His town is two hours from the city.  He now wishes to increase his production and industrialize the process.  At this time the cheese is made by hand.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He pledges to continue making his payments punctually.  He really likes working with his group because they teach him how to manage his money.

loans.use: to buy various liters of milk in order to continue producing more cheeses.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Voeurn is originally from a village of the Kror Kor District, Pursat Province of Cambodia. She is a 32-year-old married mother of two children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are dependent on her as they are too young to attend school. She has struggled to make a living through farming rice on five hectares of farmland for several years. Besides helping her grow paddy rice, her husband also works as motorcycle repairer locally to earn additional income. Together, they can earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. However, low crop yield is still the main challenge for her business. This is the first microloan for Voeurn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will use a portion of it to pay for labor costs in transplanting rice. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her living condition and set aside some money for her children’s education when they reach the age for schooling.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sule Mogga

texts.en:
Sule  is a 30-year-old  businesswoman  who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3  and 10. All of them go to school.

Sule  runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no  employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through  other clients. She is taking a loan of  2000 sdg to purchase soap, sugar  and many other items.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Sule  would like to expand her  business and open a big shop. Her  major challenges include high  transportation costs. Sule  says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan  through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, soap, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 14 years old. She describes herself to be organised and neat. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, snacks and tea. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located at an economically growing area and her primary customers are teachers, farmers and businesspersons. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. 

Beatrice will use the Kes 8,700 loan to purchase a water tank for home use. Her business goal is to buy a lorry that will help in supplying cereals  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. 

In addition, Beatrice runs a retail store where she sells maize, beans and groundnuts and offers accomodation of  rental houses which she increases her income on. She had received loan proceeds of Kes 20,000 which she managed to repay well.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Florci

texts.es:
Florci tiene 45 años, está casada con Cesarlo, con quien tiene nueve hijos, de los cuales ahora sólo viven con cinco, en la casa que compraron hace 38 años.
Se dedica a la venta de bebidas durante las festividades del pueblo, le va muy bien, pero ella desea incrementar sus ganancias y dedicarse, durante la semana, a una actividad estable. Por esa razón, hace cuatro meses, comenzó con la compra y venta de ovejas. Adquiere entre cinco y ocho ovejas, luego las vende en la feria ganadera de la ciudad. En este tiempo logró obtener buenas ganancias, como también experiencia, “cuando el precio de venta baja, guardo los animales, los alimento más y la próxima semana vendo a un precio mayor”, menciona. Ahora desea empezar a vender, pero todavía no cuenta con el capital suficiente.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Santiago de Chauca” y este es su crédito número 12 con MFP. En todo este tiempo logró obtener grandes beneficios, mejorando su negocio y aprendiendo de los integrantes de su grupo, a quienes quiere como hermanos. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Florci invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de más ovejas.
texts.en:
Florci is 45 years old, married to Cesarlo whom she has 9 children with;  five of her children still live with her in their home they purchased 38 years ago.
She sells refreshments during the town´s festivities and she does well but she would like to increase her earnings and do something during the week that is more stable.  For this reason, four months ago, she started buying and selling sheep.  She will purchase between 5 and 8 sheep and later sell them at the town´s livestock fair.  She's earned well and gained good experience during this time.  She states, " when the prices are low, I keep the animals, give them more feed and sell them at a higher price the following week.".  She would like to start selling again but does not have enough capital to do so.

She is part of the group, " Santiago de Chauca", and this is her 12th loan with MFP.  Throughout this time she's obtained great benefits, she's improved her business, and has learned from other members of the group whom she loves like brothers.  She promises to be prompt with her payments.  
Florci would invest her loan towards the purchase of more sheep.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep

loans.name: Earb's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Earb is 54 years old. She is married and has seven children, two are daughters who are still dependent on her as they are still in school. She has been in the rice farming and pig-raising business for almost twenty years. The current businesses earn her about 10,000 KHR and she manages to save about 4,000 KHR per day after daily expenses.  

The main challenge for her is the low crop yield caused by drought. To overcome this challenge, she is leading her group consisting of three members to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is in her fourth loan cycle and she successfully repaid the past loans, which have enabled her to better support her family and the current businesses. 

Earb is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use part of it to buy pig feed. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 47-year-old woman, mother of three sons and a daughter, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is very hard-working and an independent woman. By stitching clothes, she help her husband to meet the family needs and her children's education expenses.  

Zareena has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for purchasing a sewing machine for the expansion of her business. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past eight years and her clients always appreciate her work. 

Zareena is hopeful about her business success as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est est une femme de 47 ans mariée, père de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 26 ans 4 vont encore à l'école. Elle a ouvert une alimentation pres de son domicile dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gere depuis 10 ans deja. Son petit commerce fonctionne grace à son acceuiel chaleureux et à longue experience dans ce domaine et la clientele qu'elle a acquise avec le temps. Sa clientèle devient importante et là, elle n'arrive plus à sa satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Celle-ci se tourne parfois vers la concurrence, d'où l'importance de ce crédit en ce moment pour sa structure pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minerale,cartons de sucres, des friandise,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Serges réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
